review_title: Wow!! Maine is a Spectacular State

review_body: Do yourself a favor and spend time at Acadia National Park. It's a mix of ocean and mountains, history and vibrancy. Be alone or stop for a popover at Jordan House. There is no wrong way to visit this amazing place.

This is a great national park! So much to see at Acadia. Highly recommend the trip up to Cadillac Mountain and the 1/2 mile walking trail around the top. We also enjoyed the fairly easy hiking trail that included Sand Beach, Thunder Hole, Monument Cove and Otter Point. Would recommend the full ride along the 26-mile Park Loop Road. It gets busy during mid-day hours. We found parking, but you have to be patient and persistent. It's well worth a visit!
review_title: One of the best national parks

review_body: Our family of four spent 2 wonderful days in Acadia. We drove the Park Loop Road twice and saw pretty much everything we wanted to see. Here is a summary of the sights:1) Cadillac Mountain. This is a must-see, but it's VERY crowded at sunrise and sunset. The beauty of sunrise can often be hampered by too much clouds, as we experienced. If you come during daytime hours, try to come early in the morning (before 10 am). Otherwise it gets crowded on the summit and difficult to find parking. Views from the top are beautiful and expansive, but can be a bit hazy.2) Sieur de Monts. Small nature center and a small but well-maintained garden with a good variety of native plants.2) Sand Beach. A pretty beach, but again it gets VERY crowded after 9-10 am. Water is cold. If you have a couple of hours, we recommend hiking the Great Head Trail for amazing views.3) Thunder Hole. A fun stop along the Park Loop Road. Best if you come during high tide to experience the "thunder" effect.4) Fabbri A good place to eat a picnic lunch in the park. There are two dozens picnic tables under the trees (yay for shade!). Restrooms and water fountains available.5) Jordan Pond House. Nice restaurant and large gift shop, but it doesn't give much of a view of Jordan Pond itself.We recommend visiting Bass Harbor Lighthouse Head at the southern end of Mount Desert Island. It is not located in the park, but it is worth the short drive. Be sure to walk the short trail to the rocks below, and then walk onto the rocks, to get the best view of the lighthouse. Afternoon lighting is best.If you have 3-4 hours to spare, Schoodic Peninsula is also worth a visit. It is an hour away and not crowded at all. Frazer Point is beautiful, peaceful, and has picnic tables. Schoodic Point has a wide expanse of rocks/slabs jutting out to the ocean, where you can watch ocean waves crashing onto the rocks.Downtown Bar Harbor: It's a busy little beach town. Very crowded in the afternoon -- we couldn't find any place to park. We came back the next morning, and it was much better.

This was our second trip to Acadia National Park. It is a beautiful and unique place. The park was very crowded. At one point, the road to Cadillac mountain was closed due to heavy traffic. Even so, we had a wonderful time driving the loop road. There are so many beautiful stops to admire the water, rocks, and forest. We did stop for popovers at Jordan Pond House. We would like to take a carriage ride on the carriage roads on our next visit. Views from Cadillac Mountain were impressive.

Even a short visit is worthwhile. Hike some trails, run or bike the carriage trails, climb BeeHive or Precipice. See Thunderhole one hour before high tide, just look at the beautiful 15 bridges that are also some of the oldest in the nation. Just wow.

First let me say that you should visit. Even if you don't get out of the car you can enjoy a lot of beauty. 2nd, this particular attraction includes some 15 other places that are highly rated on trip advisor- so make sure not to miss all those since they are separate. A few good things to know is that they have daily rates for entry or a weekly rate. Seniors are better off to get a lifetime pass. There are many places to pull off to enjoy the view, many places to buy gifts, and if you are an outdoorsy person there is enough here to keep you busy for a week.

The park was absolutely beautiful. Jordan pond was my favorite. We also drove over to Schoodic Peninsula on the mainland, equally beautiful and less traveled. The main visitors center was at the top of about 50 stairs, so that is something to consider if you can't make the climb.
Wonderful place to visit. Easy drive through. Many nice beaches to swim and trails to hike. And for the early risers, you can catch the first sunlight to reach america everyday
review_title: One of our great national parks!

review_body: This national park is accessible in large part by car with beautiful views of the coast throughout the park. There is hiking but not miles and miles of trails. There is a sand beach with cold water, but the best part is being in the dense forest and the sweeping views of the coast. Sitting at the top of Cadillac Mountain - also accessible by car, bike or on foot - you can watch the fog roll in an out of Bar Harbor.
Must see sand Bach, thunder hole, Cadillac mountain and otter cliffs. Enjoyed on foggy day and again on sunny day!
Save your car and the environment and take the free shuttles to the park. (Thank you LLBean) Great walking, hiking and popovers.

This park requires multiple visits, to really take in everything. This was our first visit and certainly won't be our last. The trails and views are breathtaking. The parks department has a wonderful shuttle service, everything is clearly marked. There is something for everyone.

Since I can remember I have always wanted to visit Acadia National Park. I finally got the chance and I was thoroughly humbled by the experience. Stunning views abound at every turn. Drive up to Cadillac Mountain and get a panoramic view of the park. This park is not to be hurried through. Take your time, experience things that you may not experience anywhere else. I, for one, will always have fond memories of Acadia National Park.

On our trip around the country this summer, this is the 4th national park we’ve visited. Like the previous 3, this one has so much to offer the eyes. The beautiful rocky coast along the Ocean Shore path, the views from the top of Cadillac Mountain, the many wonderful hikes, the forest of trees seemingly everywhere. Parking here is pretty tough as all the major stopping points are filled up very quickly in the day. Hopefully you’ve left yourself enough time to enjoy the park so that you can do some of the important stops earlier in the day to beat the traffic (case in point – Cadillac Mountain).
review_title: Another national park with amazing sights to enjoy

review_body: Hiking in Acadia National Park was amazing. There were trails for everyone (easy, hard, long, loops, etc). The trails were also well taken care of. Trying to find the most beautiful hiking trails? What we were told by locals is that all the hiking spots were beautiful. Well they weren't wrong. The two trails we went on were both breathtaking. By breathtaking I mean: the view that makes you wonder why you live in a big city, that allows you to appreciate nature and never want to see it spoiled or damaged, the view that forces you to slow down and finally just stare out for hours.
review_title: Beautiful Beach, Rocky Coastline & Amazing Views

review_body: If you only have one day in Acadia National Park, park at Sand Beach early (before 9 am) and hike from Sand Beach to Thunder Hole and end at Otter Cliffs before hiking back. Take a snack to have on the Otter Cliffs before you walk back. You'll be back in your car by lunchtime and will beat the worst of the crowds.If you have two days, rent bikes in Bar Harbor (early!) and take the first Island Express Shuttle (line starts queuing up at 8:45 am for the 9:15 am shuttle) and get dropped off with your bike at Eagle Lake. You can do a ~13 mile bike ride with elevation around Eagle Lake and Jordan Pond before taking the Island Express back to town. The Island Express runs every 30 minutes except for during the lunch hour.And don't forget to get your National Park Passport stamps while you're there!

What a great park. The loop road was an awesome way to see the park and since we were early in the summer season traffic was not bad. Great signage and beautiful views and hiking areas. You can see ocean, mountains and other sites like Jordan Pond. Hard to see everything in one visit.

Acadia national Park offers an array of activities to visitors: sightseeing, hiking, water activities, and nature education. The view from Cadillac Mountain is breathtaking. Make sure at some point to take the drive on the grand loop - much of which is one way. Many hike portions of this stretch, however know that the hiking trail for much of it is right next to the road. The Sand Beach area is indeed what it says: it is a sand beach which could be a great place to sit in the sun and go into the cold water. When we were there many families took advantage of this. If you don’t want to sit in the sun or go in the water you you probably want to continue on. If time permits try to stop at Jordan Pond which is more like a lake. You can hike around it or go canoeing, etc. but no swimming. Jordan Pond House is also a fun place to have lunch, especially in the outdoors area. I imagine that one’s experience of the park will vary according to the weather. Luckily, it didn’t rain for us, but it wasn’t very sunny which affected the color of the water and the trees. During the summer months, be prepared for scores of other visitors to join you in sightseeing at the park. The Ranger staff was very helpful in outlying things to see.

This year was our fifth visit to Acadia National Park and we never grow tired of the gorgeous views, excellent hiking opportunities and helpful park rangers.Even though I was limited with a foot injury, my husband and I walked around Jordan Pond's right trail and were awed by its quiet beauty, and of course lunch afterwards at the restaurant. As you drive to the top of Cadilacc Mountain, you get a gorgeous view of the ocean. If you can, rise early and watch the sunrise. There is a loop road throughout the park where you can stop and take in sites. Also, you can take the Island Express, although crowded, so you don't have to drive at all. We did a bit of both, taking the shuttle to Jordan's Pond as parking is truly at a premium there. You could also bike or walk the 45 miles of carriage roads. There is so much to see that you could spend days there and still not discover all there is to see.

There are so many interesting and diverse sites to see if you choose to drive along the 27 mile Park Loop Road. There are many opportunities to park and hike, lots of pull-off stops with spectacular views, a beach, a mountain drive with spectacular views and a rocky coastline that offers ample photo ops. Whether you're in the park to hike, to climb, to relax, to dine at Jordan's Restaurant, or just to have a lovely drive for taking great photos, you'll find something just right for you.

We were here for 5 days at the end of July. The crowds were not as bad as I thought they would be, based on other reviews I read. However, every day was super foggy when I was here. This might have been why we didn't experience heavy crowds. There were a few brief periods of time within the days we were here that the fog lifted a small amount. During that time, we caught small glimpses of how beautiful this place could be. We really enjoyed our hikes, but the beautiful views people talk about were not seen by us. It was all fog, and so much of it.We still enjoyed our time here, but the fog for sure put a damper on the beauty of the area.

We have visited 19 of the United States National Parks so far, and this is one of our favorites. This park offers such a variety of activities to do and sights to see. There really is something for everyone here. With many of the parks I have had no desire to revisit, this is a park I plan to make several return visits.
Beautiful park. Wonderful views along the loop route up cadillac mountain. Easy drive with many pull over points. Impeccable national park well maintained. Will definitely visit again.
We love Acadia and we try to go off season as much as possible. But, even when crowded, you can kayak, take photo safaris, and hike to your heart's content.
One can saty many days at this park and never see or do all there is to see...so many trails and scenic by-ways and places to stop and enjooy
review_title: Such a diverse place to go

review_body: Makes you so proud to live in America. It is just so beautiful. From the mountains, to the ocean..... Thunder Hole, Jordan Pond....Mount Cadalic .....every stop took your breathe away.
review_title: You must put this on your bucket list.

review_body: So many trails to choose from, Cadillac Mountain and Jordon Ponds are must, do it before the crowds. Stay at the Blackwoods campground, so you can walk the Ocean Path.Sites are nice, a little close but that doesn't bother me, nice restrooms.

Went to Acadia for the weekend. The place was packed, but still found enough parking area to see the best sights. Incredible views from the top of Cadillac Mountain. enjoyed watching people climb Beehive Mountain from the Beach.

If you are going to Bar Harbor then you must go to Acadia National Park We walked along the very clear paths from Sand Beach past Thunder Hole and enjoyed every moment of the gorgeous views. We went up to Cadillac Mountain by car. Got lucky to get a parking spot and then was able to view Bar Harbor from the top of the Mountain. How beautiful, we could even see the land bridge to Bar Island. A spectacular place!

Awesome view from up top. We drove to the top and walked around up top and took some cool photos. Great panoramic views on a beautiful day! We stopped by Thunder Hole which is amazing too. Very limited bathroom opportunities so I wouldn’t want to do a whole day.
Really enjoyed the beautiful stone bridges, the views at the top, and the rocky shore areas...I must bring my family next time!

We visited the park 3 times while staying in Bar Harbor, once on bikes, once hiking and third time in car to Cadillac Mtn. It is naturally beautiful and worth all the time you can spend there. It is well laid out to make it efficient to pull over whenever you want and get on your bike or start hiking. Don’t miss this!

What a great trip! We loved every minute of this trip. We hiked and walked some great trails (Bee Hive, Great Head, Emery and many others). Each sight was greater than the next. Our favorites were sunset and sunrise on Cadillac Mountain. This was a trip we will never forget and one we will do again.
If you like to hike, try the Great Beach Trail. It was not crowded and had awesome views. Stay away from hiking Cadillac Mountain during the summer.

We only had one day in the area, I wish we had more. We drove around and made stops. It was crowed but the only place we had trouble finding parking as at the top of Cadillac Mountain. We parked down the road a little ways. I would have loved to hike or bike. There were lots of people doing both. The scenery is great.
review_title: I wish we had another day

review_body: I traveled solo for my first trip to the Park. I enjoyed my daily trek around Jordon Pond and a few steeper hikes on the side. This National Park is perfect for day hikes.

We had a great time exploring the park. One tip I would give is - visit the portion of the park on the Schoodic penninusula. This is often overlooked by tourist, but is a beautiful drive and has plenty of great places to explore in addition to the main portion of the park on MDI.

Had a great day exploring the park with my wife and 2 daughters. You must pay for a pass which was 30$ for the car and is good for 7 days. The vistas from the top of Cadillac Mountain were amazing. The drive along the coast was spectacular and even had a nice sandy beach to enjoy. We all loved it.

Love visiting Acadia National Park. The carriage trails are well kept, and of course the hiking is just beautiful especially when you get to the top of the mountain and the views are spectacular. Always sad to leave the Acadia area.
Our family spent a week exploring the park. The weather was hot and most parking in the main part of the park was extremely crowded. It is a beautiful park.

We spent 3 amazing days in this area. The first day was to get a general feel of the area, driving around, stopping along the way to hike at various spots after visiting the welcome center. The second day we went to the top mountain to see the sunrise--absolutely beautiful! (and crowded with probably 1000 people). Revisited the beach area and did some more hiking. The 3rd day on our way out of town did another quick drive through the area. So beautiful with the water and mountains! Definitely hope to return!

Nice place to go with the family. Please map out your paths accordingly ahead of time. Some paths can be quite challenging and strenuous. If you want to take a nature stroll, I would suggest the yellow trails. Yellow trails (paths) are the least strenuous, and allow you to really walk at your ow pace to really look at everything. On the other hand, if you like challenges choose the red paths (trails). Bring plenty of water and bug spray! Nice activity to do with yourself, family, and friends. Mother nature is truly beautiful.

Acadia is a beautiful place to visit. The drive though the park offers many outstanding views. The crowds can be heavy. You may want to visit in the morning or late afternoon. For an even less crowded view of breath taking scenery with smaller crowds visit the Schoodic Peninsula.
Beautiful park but get there early. It is ridiculously overcrowded. They should consider capping the number of visitors allowed in each day.
review_title: Beautiful park but get there early

review_body: Just returned from a 2 day trip to Acadia National Park. Really enjoyed our short trip there - nature is so beautiful when preserved and untarnished.We had one day with foul weather (mostly mist and some thunderstorms) and one beautiful clear and sunny day.At 30$ per car for a week - this is a bargain.Major points if interest- a. Sand Beach b. Cadillac Mountain c. Jordan Pond d. Otter View Point e. Thunder hole - all in the Eastern Side of Desert Mountain Island / Acadia National Park.Thunder hole - do come about 2 hours before the high tide - otherwise it is just a nice formation of rocks. Cadillac Mountain- beautiful views - especially for Sunrise and Sunset.We did the Jordan Pond Trail around the Pond - it is about 5.3kms - 2hrs hike.Less recommended- Lighthouse on West Side- waste if time IMHO.Best to stay in Bar Harbor if possible.
review_title: Diverse National Park for Nature Lovers

review_body: The free Island Explorer bus service was a great convenience in getting around the Park and into Bar Harbor without having to search for parking.

Spent five days on island. Even with a few foggy days never effected any activities. Loop road is a must do,never had any issues with traffic or crowds. Took a bike ride on carriage roads great way to see area but be prepared for some hills.Took ferry to winter harbor and biked to schoodic point.its a must see.

With a group of friends with very varying interest, there was something for everyone. Many glorious hikes from flat and easy to rocky and more challenging. Off road carriage paths for bikeing through forests without the worry of auto traffic. Kayaking, paddle boarding, nature cruising, bird watching and, of course, eating. Well the clear cool refreshing air builds an appetite, and there are ample resturants of various cuisines to suit all palates. Of course the lobster and seafood is spectacular.

My family visited Acadia in early July 2018. We stayed in a week. This was before many of the host of visitors arrive. It is an extremely beautiful park with many great hiking trails and areas to sit and enjoy the beauty of nature. Plenty of areas to pack a picnic lunch. There is a sandy beach for those that enjoy hanging out at the beach. While we did not get a chance, there are some nice dedicated biking trails (no vehicles allowed) and areas to kayak. The area reminded me of the Carmel/Monterey coastline in California with water, granite and beautiful trees. One adjacent area to the park is Bar Harbor where large cruise ships will port for the day so it can get busy.

My Fiancée and I absolutely loved our hiking trip to Acadia National Park. We hiked the great head train, hiked up to the summit of Cadillac Mountain for spectacular views, and walked the few miles around the Crystal clear waters of Jordan Pond. We loved every moment of our two day adventure. We can’t wait to visit again!!!
Usually food is not the most thought after things in National Park but Acadia definitely excel in it. I consider it best national park for foodies!
review_title: Great national park with awesome food choice

review_body: We spent 8 days in and around the park, and loved every minute. If you have a cyclist or runner, Eagle Lake has a nine mile carriage road all the way around it - our daughter ran it every day. The best views are on Cadillac Mountain - don't miss it! A little-known scenic drive is Sargeant Drive - a road right along the shoreline, looking down at lobster boats below you. If the traffic is high, take the Island Explorer free buses instead. They are everywhere, and run until 10 pm at night.
Loved the park, especially Jordan Pond and its hiking trails. Go early or take one of the buses from Bar Harbor, or visitor center as parki g can be tough during the day.

We have visited many National Parks and finally got around to Acadia. It's everything it's cracked up to be - wonderful scenery, lots of hiking and camping options and free buses that transport you from Bar Harbor to multiple destinations inside the Park. If we return it won't be at the peak of the summer season - Acadia was very crowded and the visitor's center was jammed. A better idea is to purchase your park pass from the rangers at the Village Green location where you catch the buses.
review_title: A wonderful part of New England

review_body: It takes a while to get here (Planes, trains and automobiles.) We flew into Boston and took the Downeaster Amtrak train into Maine...then rented a car. Absolutely stunning views and hikes...we ate fresh blueberries on top of the mountain. The fantastic town of Bar Harbor nestled in the middle. We are already planning our next trip (But this time we are going to spend the extra money to stay in Bar Harbor...it's worth it.) After the fifth day my family was getting tired of eating lobster, lobster rolls and lobster stew...but I wasn't!

What a beautiful park. We spent two days hiking and driving in the park. Scenery is awesome. There are a variety of hikes available so there's something for everyone. There is an entry fee - $30 per car, but it's good for several days.
We took a bus tour into Arcadia for a day trip. The guide was very informative and we had plenty of time to visit at the various stops.

My first time to Arcadia and I took my 16 yo with me. We had a great time!! We did a lot of hiking in the short 3 days. Each trail took us to different breathtaking views with various degrees of difficulty. Watching the sunrise on top of Cadillac Mountain was an amazing experience. Can’t wait to go back and explore more.
Loved it so much, I went twice. Once via At Your Service private tour (Grant) and once via e-bikes from Pedego (Jon)!

Bar Harbor is a beautiful city to visit, enjoy the restaurants and shop. However, Acadia national park is the main reason to go to Bar Harbor. What a gorgeous place. You can drive around it but great for hiking. It is definitely a must see.
review_title: A must see if you are going to Bar Harbor

review_body: A fantastic national treasure that allows for many different recreational activities. We spent one day enjoying the coastal paths while on another vigorously hiking around Mount Cadillac. Hard to believe this park is largely on one island as it is immense.

I have nothing but positive things to say about Acadia. The website was a relatively easy place to start when planning my trip, planning my hikes, routes, purchasing my pass in advance and getting updates on road/trail closures.While in the park, the park staff/rangers were helpful, very informative and appeared to truly enjoy their jobs. The park is well maintained, it's kept very clean and most of the trails and preservation areas are well marked. Some of the trail names don't align with the map, but the maps are very accurate so it's not too difficult to tell the difference. I recommend getting reading up on the trails prior to your trip. Some trail parking lots fill up very quick (e.g., sand beach, precipe trail, jordan trail, etc.) so plan accordingly. The park offers 360 degree views of island and surrounding water and islands. The views are absolutely spectacular. While we only saw a sunset, there are locations you can get unobstructed views. The park has an abundance of wild blueberries growing throughout. The berries are small, but sweet. Just pay attention and make sure it's a blueberry and not another berry. There is a good amount of wildlife throughout as well. We saw a garder snake, deer, many birds, some fish, etc. A word of wisdom, where bug spray. There are lots of mosquitoes and supposedly ticks. We didn't find any, but then again, we did use bug spray with deet.
review_title: Great Hiking and Wonderful Park Service

review_body: We went to Acadia with some recommendations from friends but mostly just a willingness to explore and see what was being offered.We went to the night sky talk on Sand Beach with the rangers even though it was a foggy night. It takes place on Wednesday and Saturday nights at 9 pm. I'm sure it is an amazing experience on a clear night but we still enjoyed learning about the names of all the moons of the year since a new moon had just occurred.We also loved exploring Cadillac Mountain and our kids did the Junior Ranger Challenge. Both were sworn in and awarded their Junior Ranger badges/patches. We also watched a sunset from on top of Cadillac Mountain and then stayed a while longer to stargaze. My kids saw constellations and satellites that they had never seen before and I saw Mars, which I had never been able to pick out before.We also loved looking at all the little critters in the tide pools at Thunder Hole (e.g. crabs, tadpoles, snails and barnacles.) The "thunder" wasn't quite what we expected but it was still interesting.I would highly recommend this park to anyone. It was beautiful!
review_title: Beautiful park and great activities for everyone

review_body: We've come here for a week or so almost every Summer for the past 10 or 12 years and continue to be amazed by its beauty. We've hiked just about every hike in the park, ridden bikes on the carriage roads, kayaked in and around the park, and enjoyed some of the prettiest views on the East Coast. I highly recommend it for any adventure seeking individuals, couples and/or families.
Acadia National Park is awesome. the views are incredible and it is the only NP on the East Coast. Crowds flock there in Summer so be sure to get up early when heading into the park.
We went as a family of 10. Everyone enjoyed the park. It was so beautiful! We went hiking and went to the beach. We drove up Cadillac mountain. What a trip!
A great national park with so much to do. Multiple hiking options, hang out at the beach, drive around to various sight seeing spots and enjoy the view!

We visited Maine for the first time this summer driving up from Boston. We booked into a 2-night stay at Camden and we went to Bar Harbor on our second day. Although the weather was overcast with drizzles from time to time, we decided that we would visit the Arcadia National Park. The park was really easy to get to (by car) and the entrance fee was $30 per vehicle (at our time of visit). Once you are there, you just need to follow the Park Loop Road to get to all the scenic points.We first stopped at Thunder Hole - where one would hear sounds of thunders when the waves pound into the cove. Unfortunately for us, the best time to hear that would be during high tide (apparently), which wasn’t the case when we visited. Next we stopped at Otter Cove - again, not the time of the year (I guess), we only managed to see a couple of seagulls. Feeling a little peckish, we then drove to Jordan Pond House for tea and tried their famous Popover - that was really yummy and did not disappoint. Afterwards, we took a quick walk round the pond. We never made it one round as we wanted to go up Cadillac Mountain - as it was supposed to have the best view at dusk. However, given the weather on our day of visit, this was definitely a mistake. We could hardly see anything beyond 20 feet driving up the mountain due to the heavy mist. As it was getting late, we finally gave up after about 20 minutes, it just wasn’t to be. Nonetheless, we thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the National Park, eventhough the weather was not ideal, it was well worth a visit. Highly recommended.
review_title: Worth a visit during any kind of weather

review_body: Acadia offers wonderful hiking trails with nice views of the craggy Atlantic shoreline. We hiked, biked on Cadillac mountain and kayaked on Jordan Pond. Thunder Hole was worth the extra stop.
A trip to Bar Harbor and not spending time at Acadia National Park, (Cadillac Mountain, Jordon Pond, Eagle Lake, etc) is like not seeing the Mona Lisa while in Paris.
Cadillac Mountain, Otter Point and Jordan Pond--best places to view unbelievable beauty--deep blue water like the Pacific Ocean in California-totally unbelievable--like Hawaii!

Have hiked in many National Parks over the years. There is something special about hiking the amazing trails here with views of the ocean and the many islands - very pleasantly different from hiking in the woods and mountains without the ocean.
5 star place, with great amount of things to do in the summer. Certify what is open befero you go so you can enjoy at the most.

It has great views of ocean and lakes. There are hikes for everyone as even my 4 and 2 year old did some. Most of the places you can get to using car, but traffic can get bad for weekends/long weekends and it might be hard to get parking at some of the points of interest. In that case there is bus service available. We did not do boat rides but heard good things from my friends who went at the same time that the dolphin watch cruise was great. Plus the sunrise at Cadillac mountain is pretty amazing. The beaches are good but the water is cold so beware of that.
review_title: Great views and hikes for everyone

review_body: I wish I had understood that the main park loop is one way. This can be a challenge if you don’t plan ahead. We explored the entire west side of my desert island in one day. Beautiful by bass harbor and don’t miss the sea wall. Beautiful roadside access. The lighthouse had a tiny parking lot so we didn’t get a spot to see that. Maybe 10-12 parking spaces? Got to Cadillac Mountain by 9 am and had no trouble parking but by 10 when we left lot was full. Beautiful hiking and scenery up there. We were fortunate to be up there on a clear day. Also enjoyed Jordan pond but was busy and hard to park and get pictures without people in them. Only one bathroom stall too? Parked at thunder hole (again only two bathrooms) and did the roadside easy hike to otter cliffs. Great stopping points on rocky shore along the way. Unfortunately it was foggy (even at noon) that day and couldn’t see water from cliffs. Couldn’t believe that fog was worse as morning went on even on a clear sunny 70s day. I would have thought the sun would have burned it off. Oh well. Made for some pretty pictures from a distance. We did the whole park in two days but we only hit main points of interest. With all the summer visitors and construction we were ready to get out of there. I’d live to go back in the fall and see the color. Beautiful place.
Be sure to take it all in...including the northwest side. Make sure you stop for a popover at Jordan Pond
Best place by far to hike on the East Coast. Fantastic well maintained trails. Lots of people at the start of the trail but getbquiter the further in you go.

The park and the island go hand in hand. The park overs the carriage roads, lakes and sum easy and hard hikes. the island overs lots of fresh lobster, whale watching and kayaking. Restaurants on every corner.
review_title: lots of fun things to do

review_body: Acadia National Park offers a lot of of hiking trails and a lovely circuit of carriage roads. We opted for a hike one day and rode the carriage roads the rest of our one week stay. Just gorgeous. The Park is beautiful, well maintained roads, lots of things to see and do. We recommend getting to any parking areas early and suggest if you're there for a week, buy the weekly parking pass.
review_title: Beautifully maintained park with excellent bike riding

review_body: Honestly truly beautiful. Has everything .. Mountainous to the sea. Unbelievable views. Has lots of hiking trails although I didn't do many as I have an ankle issue but even just driving to the spots and kind of hiking out (minimally) to those is totally worth it. I will say that having been to several other National Parks that the map here was a bit difficult to follow. Also, the parking at certain spots was SUPER full. Understandable as it was a gorgeous day and summertime. Really loved the rocky stretch between Sand Beach and Thunder Hole. As well as being atop Cadillac Mountain. Worth traveling for.

A MUST visit park! Take a hike, visit the museums, go on a ranger lead program, do the Junior Ranger program with your kids. Ocean, cliffs, surf, sand beach, lakes, mountains Acadia has it all and more!
Had an amazing time in Acadia National Park. Lots of great hikes. Wished there would be a little more parking areas, but the scenery was breathtaking. Definitely would love coming back again

We stayed on Mt Desert Island July 21 to 26 and the fog blocked the views of all the sites until it burned off around 3 or 4 pm. The locals all knew about it and said you don’t want to visit here after July 4th because of the fog. Otherwise it’s a beautiful park and we plan to return.

We spent 3 days here, drove the park loop, stopping at scenic spots. Drove to the top of Cadillac Mountain for the sunrise. Hiked Sargent Mountain, amphitheater trail and several of the carriage trails. Had popovers at Jordan Pond. There are definitely a lot of tourists here at this time of year but incredibly the park didn’t seem that crowded, except at its most popular spots - Sand Beach, Thunder Hole, Jordan Pond. Hiking up Sargent Pond on a Sunday morning was idyllic and we had the trail almost exclusively to ourselves. Bar Harbor was lively but not ridiculously crowded. Would highly recommend a visit here.
review_title: Beautiful spot. Great trails and views

review_body: Worth the trip! The carriage roads were AMAZING to cycle. Posted maps would have been helpful but we managed quite well. Park is exquisite and I look forward to coming back!
During high tide is the best. However...hang on to the railing with the crashing waves! People have been swept off of the platform.

My partner and I returned to Acadia National Park for a second time. We enjoyed four beautiful days of hiking, eating and simply relaxing. The views are absolutely astonishing. The hikes can be easy, to moderate to challenging. Some actually look more difficult than they are. All were super easy to get to and to navigate around.
We drove through and did some easy hikes. All was breathtaking but the trail along the coast was the best.

We drove the park loop in one day - could have easily gone back for more days to explore, but we loved everything. Cadillac Mountain had great views (parking is tough but we parked in the Blue Hill parking lot a short way from the summit and walked up - Blue Hill has nice views too). Sandy Beach was also a great stop as was Otter point. There are plenty of pull-offs to stop and take pictures along the way. We had a clear day with clouds and fog over the ocean and the Bar Islands which made for great photo opps.

Not sure what I was expecting from this park but WOW, it turned out to be so very impressive!! The views were incredible and there was all kinds of different things to do there. Two days was not enough!! Don't leave Maine without seeing this National Treasure!

This is a beautiful National Park! Amazing hiking and biking trails. Views from Cadillac Mountain were wonderful! Star gazing from the top of Cadillac Mountain was amazing! Echo Lake was a wonderful day at the beach. The water was cold but refreshing. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Climate was terrific. Highly recommend!!!!
The views are breathtaking. Cadillac Mountain is worth the winding roads. The carriage rides were great.
The park was beautiful, but pretty crowded. We really enjoyed the drive around the park and the hikes that we took. Cadillac mountain was impressive.
Amazing national park. Awesome hiking, biking of many different levels, kayaking, connecting with nature, and interesting history. Really great destination.

While working in Bangor, ME. I had a day off and decided to see the park and Bar Harbor. Both were very beautiful. The coastline was rocky with forests right up to the edge.View from Cadillac Mountain was breathtaking.

Oh my God. This place is amazing. Hiking - check, Climbing - check, Mountain biking - check, Swimming in the ocean - check, Playing in tide pools - check, Great restaurant - check, Breathtaking beauty and photo spots - check, Awesome, knowledgeable, and friendly rangers - check, Everything accessible even for those with physical limitations or handicaps - check.If you can, try to do Thunder Hole when there was just a storm, or it's too choppy to go on a whale watch starting at about one hour before high tide. The waves break the best under these conditions. We were only in Bar Harbor for five days and got lucky on our second to last day.
review_title: This Should Be on Your Bucket List

review_body: One of the most beautiful places we have ever been to. We went for the hiking/outdoors. Loved it.....absolutely loved it!!! If you are there for hiking, be sure to get one of the $5 trail maps at the Visitor's Center. Well worth it. When the trail says strenuous, it means it! We stayed in the Bar Harbor area but be sure to check out the Bass Harbor area as well. It's all beautiful!!!

There is a hike for everyone of all abilities in this park. We climbed two summits and sadly did not get any views because of the fog, but the climbs were a great way to spend the day anyway. You have to buy a weekly permit for the park regardless of how many days you are there. Note: the popular hikes are SUPER BUSY in the parking lot - so either go before 8am or after 11am (to catch the people leaving).

This National Park is gorgeous. Drive up Cadillac Summit Road for amazing views of the ocean and Bar Harbor. Gift shop and rest rooms at the top. Many trails for hikers. This area is popular for sunrises and sunsets, but getting in is a challenge at these times - no parking left. We arrived at 9:30 am and by the time we left 2 hrs later there was more than 1/2 mile of cars waiting to park and a policeman at the bottom of the road - not letting cars up until cars left - They really need a large parking lot with a shuttle system--everyone wants to experience this great Park-and I can't blame them. Next we went to Sand Beach - amazing beach - not too long, but great waves due to the rock formations on both sides of this beach. Water temp in late July was 55.5 degrees-brrrr. Again, parking could be a challenge. Numerous trail heads and overlooks all around the park. This park is well taken care of. Entrance fee required.

Gorgeous National Park! Don't miss the sand beach, and hearty hikers will love climbing Acadia Mountain. The beach is great for families, while the mountain is better for experienced hikers. It took my teen sons and I about 2 hours. The park loop offers breathtaking scenery. This was my first visit to Acadia, and it's now right up there with my other favorite National Parks.
Magnificent views, terrain varying from cliffs to beach to lake. Well-marked trails with lots of places to go. Wild blueberries!
Weather was foggy but great place to visit. Very accessible and inviting. Everyone should visit Acadia and stay here.

On an 8 day motorcycle ride from Baltimore to Maine and back this was one of the featured stops. Unfortunately Maine was socked in with a lot of fog but since this was a trip that had been 2 years in the planning we decided to make the best of it. We took the auto loop and were able to stop at and see many of the popular spots. The views even though foggy were beautiful. We overlooked Bar Harbor, went to Sand Beach, Thunder Hole and other popular spots. We tried to do Cadillac Mountain and got about 3/4 of the way up when the fog got to be so thick we couldn't see the tour bus in front of us. At that point we thought it best for safety to head back down. Really well maintained roads, was a pleasure to ride on. The scenery was just awesome. Plan to go back. Highly recommend.

Acadia National Park has lots to explore. There are many trails to hike and many areas to explore. Bicycle rentals are a good way to see the park. We had a car but saw many using the free Island Explorer for transportation. We drove to the top of Cadillac Mountain and were unable to find a place to park but could see the breathtaking views. We later returned on the Island Explorer Bus and enjoyed the fabulous view from the top of the mountain. Thunder Hole was great, very cool to see the ocean with the waves rushing in. We also passed the Carriage horse ride which looked amazing. If you drive, parking at some of the attractions can be a challenge especially close to Jordan's Pond. We basically circled the parking lot until a free space opened up. Acadia is picture perfect and a wonderful place to visit.
Wonderful scenery. Take the loop road and be sure to go up on top of Cadillac mountain stopping at Jordan pond for lunch.

We headed to Acadia National Park in search for puffins and mooses. We encountered only puffins and deer but could also watched humped whales from Bar harbor departing cruises. The Park is a national treasure. Lovely sightseeings. Typical Maine Landscapes around the Park loop. We did it in two hours and a half. Lots of photos. Enticing typical souvenir shops. A nice family souvenir.

Acadia National Park is absolutely one of the most gorgeous National Parks I have visited. Wonderful trails to hike, beautiful windswept beaches and wonderful smell of sea and forest. You have to put it on your list of places to visit.
review_title: One of the most beautiful National Parks

review_body: Each turn of the head offers something even more beautiful to see. Nature in all it's glory. I feel blessed to have seen it with my own eyes

So many things to do. Good for all ages. A lot of nice hikes and beautiful views. Cadillac Mountain can be a bit touristy at times, but its a nice hike and has some nice views. Love swimming at some of the local lakes as well. We try to do a different hike every time. There are so many!

We made two separate day trips to Acadia while visiting Maine this July. It's long been a dream of mine to visit this beautiful spot, and I am already planning my next visit. Our first day, we arrived by 8:30 a.m. (Thanks to a whale watching excursion that was cancelled due to fog and rough seas) and parked at Sand Beach, and walked the Ocean Path out and back. What a great way to experience some of Acadia's most beautiful views! The path was very, very clogged around Thunder Hole, but less crowded as you went along. We veered off the path to find secluded spots on the rocks over the ocean. We finished with lunch at Jordan Pond House. The second day we drove around the park and hopped out at various spots. Unfortunately, they closed down the road up Cadillac Mountain, and an injury meant I wasn't up to hiking to the summit. Next time! Time on the sea wall was especially beautiful, though. Acadia is a treasure!

Acadia is a truly beautiful place with exciting, well laid out trails with some amazing views.We went on Gorhman and Jordan's Pond Trails and loved both.Here's the thing, parking is tough. We used the buses our second day in the park. There were comfortable and convenient, but getting out of the park at the end of the day it was crowded.If I had a choice, I would go to Acadia either before or after summer vacation season. Even so, I'm totally glad we went and would go there again even in the summer.
We enjoyed our time at Acadia National Park. Visitor Centers were helpful, and we especially enjoyed our time at the nature center where one family member became a Junior Ranger!

If you hike, enjoy one of many trails but don't miss the somewhat challenging South Ridge Trail on Cadillac Mountain and Great Head Trail by Sand Beach. Cyclists have tons of options that don't include sharing the road with motorists. Be sure to check out the carriage paths for both walking and cycling. The Jordan Pond-Eagle Lake loop will keep your average cyclist busy for a few hours and is a great way to see both bodies of water. Enjoy!
review_title: Great National Park with trails for hiking and biking for all levels of expertise.

review_body: We started at the blackwoods campground and did the south ridge trail. Beautiful views at many spots. There is a bathroom at the top. It’s not an easy hike but there are definitely harder mountains to climb.
Beautiful in every way. We have not often seen such pristine surroundings. Lots of trails for hiking and biking. Beaches, beautiful scenery. Spent lots of time in the park and loved it.

Been to the park many times, most amazing sites and peaceful time are on the carriage trails. Lovely ponds, lake. The drive that includes the beach and thunder hole nice, but get away from crowds and onto the carriage trails! Also recommend Cadillac Mountain for sunrise - arrive at least 40 minutes before sunrise to see the amazing colors of the changing sky.
We drove the loop around the park stopping a few spots. Most parking areas were filled. As our waitress told us earlier, June and July are the two sunny months here. Many beautiful vistas.
Maine is SOOOO beautiful! This park is a must see for families and those loving the coast. Easily done on your own.
This is an absolute must do when on MDI!! Stunning views and beautiful grounds to sit, hike or picnic.

Acadia National Park is a lovely park with many hiking trails to suit every hiker, ranging from easy sea-side trails to difficult mountain trails. We took the Gorham Mountain trail, connecting to the Beehive trail and the Ocean Path trail, through many rocky mountains and fresh air. There are also free shuttles from most Bar Habor area motels to the park, but be aware that whether you take the shuttle or drive, you need to pay a pretty high entrance fee ($30 per car or $15 per person).
review_title: Many hiking trails, free shuttle, lovely views

review_body: The trails begin about 2km from the centre of Bar Harbor; the last km is a pretty good climb on a bicycle. The trails and 16 unique and beautiful bridges were financed through John D. Rockefeller Jr. between 1913-1940. No carriages or cars can use these roads today--just walking and bikes.The fine-gravel trails meander through forest, ponds, and lakes. Plenty of peaceful places to sit and relax and enjoy Rockefeller's gift of making the outdoors accessible to us all. When using the park maps (provided at entrances to the park) be sure to refer to the handy numbers on direction posts to determine your exact place in the park.
review_title: Over 70 kilometers of carriage roads to walk or cycle

review_body: Loved the drive in Acadia Park. Lots of places to pull over to take pictures or enjoy a hike. Very picturesque.

Many different free shuttles offered to tour the park.We took the loop and saw so much... disappointed we couldn’t get to the top of Cadillac MountainAlso disappointed the driver was so soft spoken we almost missed the bubble rock!Souvenir spot offered great books and information to highlight this gem!

Got touring tickets from Testa Restaurant.One cannot say enough for having anexperienced tour operator. Think ourguide was born about 1943. So, it wasnot his first rodeo. However, it wasjust a grand ole time.

Don't miss this beautiful park when visiting. We ended up taking the car and stopped along the way. There are many ways to travel through the park via car, tour bus, hiking, and biking. There are places to stop to swim so bring a suit. Also, make sure to wear comfortable shoes. Taking a picnic lunch is a good idea. There is one restaurant but there are many picnic areas throughout the park.

We visited Acadia during our stay at Bar Harbour. It is beautiful and a must-see if in the area but it was also unbelievably busy! I would definitely recommend a guided tour (we had a CD which provided directions up the mountain and guided us to the must-see spots along the way). If you are going in summer be aware it does get extremely busy due to it being such a popular destination. We looked for parking at Jordan's Pondhouse for a total of 1 1/2 hours and missed a few places along the way to unavailability of parking. About 30-40 minutes to get parking at Cadillac Mountain. It can be frustrating if unprepared so bring water and snacks if driving! If I were to do it again, I would get the tour bus, which seemed to drop people off at the important spots along the way without the drama of finding parking, although I'm not sure how costly an option this is? We didn't have time to do any hikes, which I would definitely make time to do next time. A walk around the lake at Jordan Pond is definitely a must-do (took us about an hour). Make sure you stop for popovers first at Jordan's Pondhouse. In busy season, again, it can be about a 40-minute wait for a table so make sure you plan for that but it is worth it! Also super dog-friendly with great service!
review_title: Definitely worth a visit, be careful in busy season!

review_body: You could spend weeks at Acadia and not see everything that it has to offer. There are several "must dos." Your best bet to get the most out of your time here, is to research. I watched YouTube videos about various hikes, read reviews, TripAdvisor forums, and other websites. Purchase your pass online to avoid lines. Drive the loop first to get your bearings. Going with a plan will make your visit much more enjoyable. This place is a slice of heaven, and I would love to return.

My best friend and I went there from the 19th to the 23rd to hike the mountains. She had never been and we had discussed made very good plans. We started our climb to Dorr Mt. and Cadillac Mt. from the Cannon Brook Trail to Kane Path then up the ladders. Both she and I had a great time.Views are excellent. We walked around Jordan Pond and also did the Bubbles. The last day we did Gorham and Half way starting at the Gorham Mt trail. She went down the ladders at the Beehive. "lucky Girl". Just by sheer luck we found Asticou Gardens in Asticou. Try not to miss this!!
Stunning views. The whole area is just gorgeous and untouched. I would like to spend more time in the park on my next visit
Absolutely beautiful park, Hiked cadillac mountain, don't be fooled it is truly hiking not a little walking path. Overall, a great day.
Beautiful Place but foggy most of the time we were here. This is a great place to visit, but weather can change quickly.
We rank Acadia as one of the top National Parks in US. And we have been visiting many parks. The free shuttle buses really makes the traveling inside the park very stressful and fast.

We spent a day in Acadia National Park. The scenery of sea and mountain is spectacular. We stopped many times to gaze in awe and take photos. The Visitor’s Center personnel were very helpful in selecting the best pass for our family and the sites to see. We followed their advice and took the Loop Road. An excursion to Bass Point Lighthouse is good but it is off the beaten path and it is difficult to get out on the rocks far enough to get a good view. Our last stop in the evening was Cadillac Mountain, the highest point on the Atlantic shore. It was sell worth the trip. As Theodore Roosevelt said, “We need Acadia.” Amen!

This was our 3rd visit to Acadia National Park. We love the cool weather, the great scenery and the wonderful hiking. I recommend taking your time to do drive the Park Loop and stop to enjoy the scenery. Get there early and do the Beehive hike. While it is a steep hike, it's doable as long as you are not afraid of heights. There are many things to see and I can't list them all here but there are many sites that will help you decide on what hikes or what stops you can do.
review_title: Great park, great views, nice hiking.

review_body: We try to find new places in the park to explore. But we still hit the top of Cadillac mountain for the views. This year, we did JordanPond. We went left while most of the people go right. We chose left because it was in the sun and we wanted to finish in the shade. Left is also a little bit more challenging so start out strong and finish easy. It is a lovely hike.. parts were under construction but we were able to go around the entire pond even though others kept telling us the path was closed.. evidently they could not read the detour signs the park put up. My kids also took the bubble trail off of Jordan Pond and they said that was extremely challenging and they were pretty sure us parents would not have been able to do it. They had fun
review_title: this visit was to hike Jordan Pond

review_body: The Park Loop road is a 2+hr drive if you account for stops along the way. Stops like The Thunder Hole (which was underwhelming the day we went due to a calm sea) and The Sand Beach (which was also underwhelming given the intense fog which pervaded that day). Just because our day drive wasn’t in idyllic conditions doesn’t diminish the beauty of the shoreline, bogs, forest paths, along the way. We completed the trek up Cadillac Mountain, where we played in the clouds - literally. Having driven and explored many of Canada’s National Parks, Acadia National Park is inline with most - the exceptions being Cape Breton, Banff, Jasper - parks whose beauty outranks the Acadia National Park considerably.Stop in at the Visitor Information Center as you enter Mount Desert Island to pick up your Park Pass ($30 USD) and save yourself the line-up at the park entrance.
review_title: Park Loop worth the meandering drive

review_body: We hiked, we had picnic with fresh lobster, we looked at the ocean (but too cold to swim) and we enjoyed the beautiful place.

We took the free bus from Bar Harbor to Acadia early (8:00) in the morning. We avoided the crowds and were able to take our time getting acclimated to the set-up of the park. We continued riding the bus throughout the day and noticed that several of the parking lots were full; three cars were parked in the bus loading zone at one and had all be ticketed. The views were great and were a lot of trails to walk. We got to Jordan Pond about 11 and made a reservation at the restaurant. Make sure to order the popovers! They serve them hot out of the oven and they are delicious! I would recommend going early in the morning and definitely using the bus system; which is free. We visited the Tourist Information Center in Bar Harbor the day before going and they gave us excellent information about how to use the bus system to see more of the park.
Went early in the day and we were rewarded The little islands were all capped w fog ... what a view Best view is from the top of Cadillac mountain
lovely national park, with easily accessible driving and walking/hiking trails. We have our favourite spots here and often visit them again and again and again each trip

Drove up here to the park on a 14 passage van. Well worth the time to get an overview of the park. You will want to come back on your own at some time. We were coming from a cruise ship and only had a bit of time to see the park. Great place for walking trails and horse & carriage trails. The view from Cadillac Mountain is beautiful and on a clear day, get a view of all the islands around the area.

No matter how many times we have visited, there is always something new to see. This year we discovered Jessup Path with its beautiful white birches lining the trail. Also visited Wild Gardens of Acadia we we found pitcher plants. Rocky beaches. Don’t miss low tide and walking the sandbar yo Bar Harbor Island,

Acadia National Park has to be one of the most beautiful places on earth! We visited in June. The weather was perfect for hiking. Make sure you wear comfortable clothes and shoes. Some of the trails are long. We stayed in a quiet lake cabin about 45 minutes away which is perfect because Bar Harbor is very busy.

Acadia is a beautiful place. I suggest using the shuttle system. We drove into the park and parked at the main visitor center at 10 am and then took the shuttles. The other parking areas along loop road were already full. The ocean path is easy and very scenic with taking side detours climbing on the rocks. We did the grab and go for sandwiches at Jordan Pond. The only place to eat in the park is Jordan Pond restaurant and it is a sit down place. We ate on the balcony and then hiked around the Pond. Half the trail is easy and the other half has challenging sections with rocks to climb over it takes around 2.5 hours. The Eagle Lake trail is moderate to hard and the Gorham mountain trail is moderate due to the elevation change and the path but very worth the view. We were able to find parking in Bar Harbor both evenings for dinner in the middle of town. We stayed at the Acadia Pines which is 5 minutes from the park.

One of the things on my bucket list checked this year Acadia national park maine have so much to offer . Loved the sunrise at the top of Cadillac mountains. Cold beer at Jordan pond and swim at sandy beach is must thing to do.Loop around the park is awesome drive.

I've had the luxury of visiting over twenty national parks, and it's a toss-up between Yosemite and Acadia as the best national park. Acadia happens to be my favorite, as it's the first I visited and have been more than any other (exceeding 20 times, now). Acadia has a beauty and magic to it that no other place on earth has. The views are charming, the travel is easy, the recreation is phenomenal, and it is nothing short of an American classic.
review_title: One of the best national parks

review_body: This is the first national Park we've been to and if definitely does not disappoint. The staff and rangers are very helpful and friendly. The park is really clean and the views are spectacular. The day we went was a bit foggy but that does not detract from the beauty... In some ways it made it even more so. Definite put this in your list of places to see. Safe travels

We enjoyed 3 days at this park. It's beautiful. The only negative thing is that there was always so many people..... Sunrise on Cadillac Mountain: Amazing, but so crouded! I wasn't expecting so many people, but it was ok. We hiked, and the longer hiking trails were more enjoyable for us, as less people were encountered. We wanted to enjoy nature, which we did, as long as we avoided the "hot spots"! But this is an amazingly beautiful place!

We had a great trip of biking and hiking (and even a bit of beach time). Bar Harbor is a wonderful place to stay with a fabulous bus system into the park where you can even bring your bike (or rent a bike and bring on the bus). Restaurants and bars were fabulous. We actually didn't have too many crowds given the time of year. The views are spectacular. The weather was perfect outdoor weather!
review_title: Lovely in July! Great active vacation!

review_body: Acadia is one of the prettiest places we have seen in our USA. We rode the National Park Explorer from Village Green in Bar Harbor. Being of a good age, we didn't have to pay the park entrance fee. The park is just amazing...so green and we were very amazed that there were no insects swarming us! We hiked the trail between Sand Beach and Otter Point. The views of the ocean were just awesome. A great place you do NOT want to miss when in this region of the country.

This was the first US national park I visited. I loved it at that time. Although, this one seems to be not so popular, as compared to some in and around the West Coast, but the park did not disappoint me at all. We had good fun, great hikes and spectacular views.
Took my two children, ages 10 and 6 on several hikes and they had a blast. They have trails for every experience/ability level and each one has something unique to offer! A must see area of Maine.

Huge scenic vistas, awesome trails perfect for little feet. They have a junior ranger program for kids. Traffic can be a bear, but take it in turn. We have loved this spot of earth for years and are now sharing it with the kids. I highly recommend it.

On Friday we arrived at the Hull Cove Visitors Center at Acadia National Park! At the top of 52 steps is the Visitors center where you can purchase a park pass( we have the Senior Pass) Also, Park Rangers are available to answer any question you may have! There is also a park store. If you have Passport Book the park stamp is located here!They have a big parking lot where you board the Island Explorer Electric Bus. The bus is free and you can do the 27 mile park loop. We were able to get off and many of the park spots. Cadillac Mtn the bus doesn’t go up to but let’s you off by hiking trail. There is a beautiful beach at Sands beach but water was too cold for us!Lots to see at this beautiful park!

Make sure you take the drive along the coast south and then continue up to Cadillac Mountain. If you are there at the right time, make sure you stop at the "Blow Hole" for a wet surprise. The scenery is magnificent!!!

We visited on a holiday weekend, our bad. The traffic and parking were horrendous with cars blocking both sides of the road (despite the no parking signs and warnings of tows) making passing impossible. The park itself is gorgeous I just wish we had more opportunities to actually enjoy it. Do yourself a favor and visit during a less popular time.
review_title: Beautiful scenic vistas, surrounded by a lot of traffic.

review_body: If Acadia NP is on your bucket list, don't hesitate to take it off.Beautiful views. Plan to spend a few days up there and hike some of the trails. Ocean View and Sand Beach is an easy trail for all.
We drove to top of Cadillac Mountain along with hundreds of others. The view from the top was breathtaking. Could not believe some people actually biking the entire way!
If you like hiking, and breathtaking views, you will love Acadia. There are dozens of trails both marked and unmarked.
We had a wonderful time hiking, biking, and exploring this park. Our child loved becoming a Jr. Ranger and all of the rangers we met were so friendly. Would love to come back to this park every year.

We rented bikes in Bar Harbor and used the same company’s shuttle to travel a short distance into Acadia National Park. We rode 20 miles on the Carriage Trails which only allow hikers, bikes (non-electric), and horses/carriages. Stunning!
review_title: A great park for day trips and outdoor activities.

review_body: Drove to Cadillac mountain before anyone else. Love that time of the day with no crowds. Saw a jack rabbit! A few birds: towhee, robins, common yellow throat. Beautiful park. Mostly enjoyed by hikers and bicycles. Bathroom us available on Cadillac mountain.
review_title: Early early is best to avoid crowds

review_body: If you're a photographer you have to visit Acadia. It is especially nice if you visit the park with Howie.
review_title: Best National Park in the US

review_body: Acadia is beautiful! We spent 3 days in the park, hiking and biking. My son, 18, felt that was long enough. I may enjoy wilderness hikes more than he does and so could have stayed a few more days exploring.

We’ve been to nearly all of the major National Parks and Acadia remains one of our favorites. We’ve been coming here for over 25 years and the beauty is always breathtaking. The coast on the “loop road” has some of the most beautiful views I know and the view from Cadillac Mountain is wonderful. Try to do a hike or two. A couple of easy hikes near Jordan Pond are The Bubbles and Jordan Stream. Don’t forget to stop at the Jordan Pond House for popovers.
We did multiple things but the top three were walking Sand Beach, seeing Thunder Hole, and watching the sunset from Cadillac Mountain. Love this park!
review_title: Thunder hole and a sunset to name a couple!

review_body: Acadia is an outstanding experience for the whole family. You can easily spend a week or more here and still not see everything! It is completely worth the effort to drive to the top of Mount Cadillac before sunrise to watch the sun come up! Get here at least 75 to 90 minutes before sunrise to get a parking spot. The sunrise at top of Mount Cadillac is spectacular! Acadia is a great choice for anyone who wants to enjoy the splendor and majesty of our national parks. It is a true treasure!
Great hiking with beautiful views! Be sure to stay on the island and spend a few days. Too much to see and do on a single day.
The whole drive through the park is very worthwhile. Remember if you are a senior you can get a special pass. Lots of special sites along the way. Traffic moved well.

Spent about 1 1/2 days touring the park. On the first day hit the big attractions, Sand Beach, Thunder Hole, Otter Cliffs, Jordan's Pond House, Cadillac Mtn, Bubble Rock. Started out on the Island Explorer bus, ended the day driving our minivan. We did the ranger's star program at night on Sand Beach. It was good and informative, saw a lot of stars, though the half moon really messed it up. HUGE tip; don't go to Thunder Hole at high tide, you will not get the affect. We got to go by earlier in the morning and heard the "thunder" and then went back by at high tide to get our NPS books stamped and thought we'd go see it again. Nothing, I felt sorry for the people staring and probably wondering "what's the big deal about this?" It was full of water so as the waves came in there was no boom. We went to Echo Lake on our 1/2 day and swam, the water was cold but we got use to it quickly and it was very refreshing. Great view swimming at the base of the mountain. Left Echo Lake and went to Bass Harbor Head Lighthouse. Very small parking lot. Tip: take the path to the left of the lot and be prepared to climb some rock to get a really good view of the lighthouse. Its a very short hike.
There are so many places to go and things to see here. From hiking up Cadillac mountain to walking along the shore, there are plenty of places for people of all abilities

There is so much to do here that nature lovers can easily spend a week hiking, biking or exploring. Check out Jordan Pond, Cadillac Mountain and the countless trails throughout the park.Park passes are usually good for for seven days. I believe admission is free later on in the day.

Rode all the carriage roads and climbed two mountains. We were here for a week and barely covered this awesome place. The free island shuttle is great and I recommend anyone visiting to use it to avoid parking issues. All trails were well maintained and marked. Bring plenty of water. We will definitely be back!

Had not been here for 30 years so I had a wonderful time! Visit the park at different times of day to get different views and lighting. Sunrise is good not only on top of Cadillac, try the point for a nice water view.
review_title: Fantastic National Park with great water and woods views

review_body: We enjoyed hiking, bicycling and dining at the Jordon Pond restaurant. We used and were grateful for the free shuttles into the park, especially the bike shuttle. Trail ratings were appropriate for the healthy, fit young ones in our group but a rating of easy could turn into somewhat of a challenge for the older folks.
review_title: Breath taking views and user friendly

review_body: We spent several days in Bar Harbor and each day and a couple of nights were spent in the park. Gentle walking to much more challenging hiking and biking are just some of the things to do... The weather was so great, mid 70s during the days and mid to low 60s at night in July, just wonderful for being outdoors. We hiked up to and down from Cadillac Mountain, a little bit challenging, mostly for the distance involved and length of the trip. Great views of most of the park on the way down! In the evenings we would drive up to the top of Cadillac for the outstanding star gazing in the cool night air. My wife and I had a great time and we highly recommend a visit!

The park is not doable in one day. Most suggest a week and we did it in 2 days. We spent a lot of time in Bar Harbor. The views are absolutely breathtaking and the shops were cute and fun to look around. We then stopped at Sand Beach which was really neat. It was cold and windy the day we went so just checked out the views and left. We then started walking to Thunder Mountain, but it's quite a trek with a stroller. We didnt make it all the way there, but did see some more stunning views on our walk. We ended up driving to Thunder Mountain and I stayed in the car w the kids while husband checked it out, he says it was pretty neat and worth the stop. We drove around the entire island checking out all of the villages, though none of the others had anything we stopped at outside of beautiful views. We stayed the night at Kimball Terrace Inn on Northeast Harbor. The next day we went back to acadia since it was foggy our first day to get clearer views and we are so glad we did. We saw the top of Cadillac Mountain both with rain and fog and clear and beautiful. It does not disappoint. It has bed rock to run around on, a path and amazing views. We used the stroller but there are some stairs so husband and I had to carry it up/down. Wasnt awful and view was worth it, but be prepared. The gift shop has blueberry soda which was pretty tasty! The lighthouse in Bass Harbor was breathtaking and worth the drive. Theres also a walking path to some stairs to the left of the parking lot. Those stairs go down to more rocks to get you and even closer view of the water and boats.

I grew up going to Acadia and this is where I fell in love with nature. Sunrise or sunset the views are incredible and outside of the city lights you can see every star. Hikes around Jordan pond are a nice way to spend an afternoon with friends or family and are kid friendly. If you like the water and a little adventure then I would strongly suggest Otter Cliffs and Sand Beach, the walks along the cliffs are truly beautiful and the beach can be a nice quiet spot in off peak months.

If you enjoy hiking and the beautiful scenery, you will love this park. We barely touched the surface of hikes in this area, but we LOVED every minute of it! There are some easy trails and some for the more adventurous souls where you are scaling on the side of a mountain with bars drilled into the trail to help you navigate along without falling. It was really fun! The rocks on the side of the road awesome and fun to climb on. You will not be disappointed with the beauty of the place.

Such a beautiful national park. We were only in the area for a day and I wish we'd had more time. We drove the Loop Rd and stopped at many points to explore the area. Sand Beach and Cadillac Mountain are musts. Hope to return to bike on the carriage roadways and go hiking!
Rugged rocky coastline, pristine waters, magnificent hiking trails, scenic viewpoints, lovely campgrounds. This is all a National Park should be. Visit and leave only your footprints.
review_title: The Epitome of Maine at Its Finest

review_body: Pretty National Park. Wasn’t the biggest or the most awesome of the parks but did enjoy our time there. We were there mid July and it was terribly crowded. Traffic was awful we witnessed a tussle in the Jordan Pond parking lot over a parking space. Maybe a quieter time of year....

Amazing hiking opportunities. We spent 3 days hiking and exploring and could maybe have done 1 or 2 more. Our visit was in June. There were no bugs, but it did heat up so we started our hikes early. Even the "moderate" trails have spots that are pretty challenging with the size of the rocks. Sunscreen and water are a must, as well as good hiking boots with a thick tread - tennis shoes won't work. Be careful where you park - they are proactive on ticketing. There is a bus that stops at trail heads.

Purchased the pass at the Bar Harbor Visitors Center. Once entering the park, the Ranger exchanged this for a hanging mirror placard. The drive around the large loop is filled with jaw-dropping views. There are numerous parking areas and if you want, you can stop and park in the right lane. Yes, be aware that there are two lanes on the loop, the right lane is used for parking. The driver needs to have eyes forward looking for stopped vehicles not looking at the sights. The trip to Cadillac Summit is winding and you may pass bicycles. There are several parking places on this road. Once at the summit, you can walk on a park made path or on the granite in designated places. Views are eye-opening. The park's visitors center is a climb of 50+ steps from the parking lot. There is a separate entrance for handicap vehicles that is on the level of the visitors' center. Recommend entering at the 0900 to beat the rush of visitors. We did not do any hiking but hear this is fantastic.

This is a must see place with enough to see and do for a couple of days. It offers a range of places to see depending on what you like, mountain tops, beaches, rocky, oceanside cliffs, ponds, and trees galore! So much to explore. It is one of our favorite National Parks!
Spend a lot of time here--it is a great place to visit--single, couple, and families--bring your bikes and canoes.

This park is beautiful! Drive up to Cadillac Mountain and take in the views. Many hiking trails and carriage roads to bike or horseback. You can get your pass at visitor center but it is easy to print online also. This is a must stop if in area!

We spent a full week exploring this Beautiful Park for the first time. This was the 30th USA National Park we have visited. We stayed in a beautiful rental home on the west side of Somes Sound ( quiet side) as a home base to explore all areas of the park. We went to a different section every day and did 13 day hikes during the 6 full days we were there. Each area was unique and beautiful. I am glad we had the time to thoroughly explore many parts of this park by car and by foot. Thank You National Park Service and benefactors of this exceptional Park.Dan & Karen MurphyOld Bridge, New Jersey
review_title: Beautiful National Park with Much to do and see

review_body: You cannot go to Maine without visiting Acadia National Park. However. there is so much to see and do that 1 week really isn't long enough. You could visit several times and still have many sights to see and things to do. Acadia National Park is as nice as described. Pictures do not justice. Just absolutely beautiful. There is nothing I don't like. Like Heaven and the stars are out of this world....can't wait to return.

We were told the Park Loop was very busy during the day so we entered the park about 7:00 p.m. The parking pass is good for seven days, even though we knew we would only be using it for an evening. We drove the entire loop in less than two hours. With this initial visit, we know where we would want to spend more time during future visits.

Acadia offers some stunning views of the Maine landscape. We highly recommend going to Cadillac Mountain for sunset, but be advised, it will be crowded. While we appreciated the park and its beauty, it does not offer the same panoramic views as the Grand Tetons and other Western mountain ranges.
Get some popovers at Jordan Pond House and also go to Sand Beach. Great area for swimming and wonderful views at otter cliff and Thunder Hole.
review_title: Jordan Pond House, Otter Cliff Thunder Hole

review_body: Can't say enough good things that haven't already been said by others. I went with my 6 month pregnant wife and my mother who has nerve damage in her feet and we still had a memorable day!We simply drove around using Park Loop Road and stopped along the way for the sites we were interested in as we passed them. We took our time and ended up spending about 3-4 hours in the park. We stopped at the Wild Gardens, had lunch at Fabric with the food we packed in, and took a short walk at Jordan Pond and at the peak of Cadillac Mountain.My wife and I will certainly return when we're able to do more exploring, but I wanted to emphasize that anyone can really enjoy this beautiful park.
review_title: Enjoyable for ALL - Even those with physical disabilities

review_body: Great hiking trails, beautiful views / vistas. Enjoyed our stay and would love to return. We spent several days in the park. The Loop is 27 miles and allows the visitor to easily travel from one beautiful site to the next. Cadillac Mountain has 360 degree views. Our timing was great because the weather was perfect. Sand Beach is nice, but you have to be a Polar Bear to enjoy the 55 degree water.

This park has so many layers! Start by hitting the main spots and then delve deeper into it. Tons of trails and attractions to choose from. We fell in love with this park and want to go back and stay for a whole week. We only did 2 nights there. Drive around Ocean Path and park at every parking lot and get out and look at the amazing sights. Walking that trail isn't really necessary. Save your energy for a more exciting trail that you can only access on foot. You should go in the evening when everyone is leaving. There was tons of parking then. It does get CRAZY crowded. Be prepared to park far away from some things and walk a bit if you go in the morning or afternoon especially. Wild Gardens was like that. Very crowded. Sand Beach also very crowded but great if you want the sandy beach experience. We were there to explore, so we only stopped briefly to see it. If you are not a plant buff, skip the Wild Gardens. I wouldn't do them again, though I did love taking pictures of the dew on the leaves and the few flowers and blueberries that were in bloom there. It's a quick stop if you want to do it. You can easily avoid crowds by going deeper into the trails or going early in the morning or else in the evening. If you want a fairly easy hike with amazing coastal rocky views and waves splashing - do the Ship Harbor Trail on the quiet side! We loved it and it only takes like an hour if you don't stop - maybe 2 if you stop and sit on the rocks or go tide pooling. This park is huge and beautiful and wonderful.
There is so much to experience in this expansive and beautiful park. I have been dozens of time and each visit offers something new.

If you are going to be in Bar Harbor, this is a must see Park !
