Incredibly scenic views, amazing coastline and wonderful weather !Cadillac Mountain might not be that tall, but it definitely provides a panoramic view of the waters around Bar Harbor !We took a tour bus here, but it was obvious that many people drove up. Parking is limited, so we were glad to be on the bus !

While the state park pass price caused some pause, really glad we spent a day exploring Acadia national park. Enjoyed the ocean views, went on a short nice hike, enjoyed the pop-overs at the lake lodge (forgot name), and Cadillac mountain views are spectacular (a must see)!
review_title: Acadia is beautiful, worth the trip!

review_body: I forget how cool the U.S. is sometimes and when I travel it really blows my mind. An underrated spot; everyone will find something they love. Good food, culture, and amazing nature.
review_title: There's no other vacation this affordable and amazing

review_body: We have visited all 50 states and Acadia National Parks is one of our favorite places to visit. Hiking up Cadillac Mountain for sunrise is spectacular.
review_title: One of our favorite national parks.

review_body: Acadia is a beautiful national park, but the crowds can be difficult to deal with in the summer. Get up early and visit Cadillac Mountain and the loop road and then you can truly enjoy the experience. Route 3 into Bar Harbor is under construction and one way so a lot of extra traffic is in the park through 2019. The less crowded parts of the park are Northeast and Southeast Harbor park roads and Schoodic Peninsula.

Our favorite place in the entire world and we have been fortunate enough to have been several places. We return here almost every year and have been doing so since 1979. Each time here we are able to find a trail we have not yet hiked. How is that possible?

we only live about a 4 hour drive from here but had never visited. It is so amazing, views are just beautiful!! Sand beach is one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever been to and the top of cadillac mountain is spectacular Park staff are extremely friendly and helpful. $30 per car is the biggest bargain around!
We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of the park. The driver was very well informed and gave loads of information about the park.
review_title: Took the bus tour of Acadia and it was great.

review_body: We went in peak season and all the picturesque spots were packed. We did not walk the trails or bike the carriage roads and maybe that experience would have been better. We used the free buses (which are excellent and take bikes) to get around some of the time which solved the nightmare of trying to find parking. Certainly a beautiful area but so is a great deal of Maine. You can get the same scenery but without the crowds by going up country. Won't be going back - at least not in the summer.
Beautiful National Park but the most rugged scenery was harder to locate. I wish we had been able to hike to some of those views. Very green and the water is beautiful!
This is a scenic wonder of a National Park! You must stop and take the short hikes to get into nature here!
review_title: Great short hiking trails with high reward views!

review_body: What a immaculate park. This is so well maintained. So many areas to stop and take photos along the road.
If you've not visited, make the trip! the views from Cadillac Mountain are terrific and the park is so scenic. Great hiking and sightseeing in this park.
review_title: Best national park in the US

review_body: We've visited several national parks, but this one is easily a favorite. We love when there is historical significance also associated with such beautiful landscapes. From hiking down to Sand Beach up to Beehive Trail then chasing from one Rockefeller bridge to the next on the Carriage Roads our kids had a blast. Kids still ask about hiking Beehive Trail again, just wish we were closer and we'll definitely try to make it back to Acadia.

Was a wonderful park to visit. We had a great time at Jordan Pond, must have the Popovers at the restaurant there. We went to top of Cadillac Mountain, beautiful view of the area. We hiked Great Head trail which was a good moderate hike. And really enjoyed getting to see Thunder Hole. We took the bus in and out of the park and was super convenient.

We like to go to national parks and walk. This one has a great walk between Sandy Beach and Otter Cliffs--the views of the coast are fantastic. It is 2.2 mile and fairly flat with good trail to walk on. Most people park in Sandy Beach to do the walk, but even though it is a large parking lot, it fills up quickly. We drove to Otter Cliff and parked there and walked back to Sandy Beach. We then caught the free bus which took us back to our car. If you this starting at Sandy Beach, you can't catch the bus as the road is one way between the stops.

Acadia is just beautiful... One of the highlights of our Bar Harbor trip was watching the sunset on one of the pull offs on Cadillac Mountain. Finishing our trip tonight by going to view the stars on Sand Beach!
review_title: So much to see and do

review_body: I love this national park. Free buses, going on several routes, took me to many of the trailheads. I could pick those suited to my abilities and even in busy July, I was often alone on one of the myriad trails - hearing birds, smelling pines, and feeling cool breezes. This place is magic.

Acadia is my favorite go to place. It combines mountains and the sea for a great place to hike and get into nature. There are a variety of trails where you can lose yourself and just get away. The food and small towns that surround the park are also fun.

We walked from Bar Harbor to the park and then explored for the day. I have to say this exceeded my expectations - absolutely beautiful. We are used to Banff National Park so we are familiar with touristy towns and beautiful scenery......this was wonderful. Really enjoyed walking the carriage roads and finding the beautiful bridges. Great history here, beautiful scenery and relatively close to town. Hope to go back!
review_title: Love the hiking, beautiful scenery and the carriage trails are wonderful to see!

review_body: The park is absolutely one the the most beautiful places I have ever been to. Spectacular mountain views, crystal clear ponds, and fabulous hiking trails. If you love the out-of-doors, don't miss it. It also is a photographers paradise, so take your camera. One week is not enough time to do all that it has to offer. We will return again.
This is the iconic wonder of New England National Parks. Easy to drive yourself and tons of tours to choose from.Highly recommended
Always a great time coming to Acadia. Every hike has breath taking views. The park and the campgrounds are very well maintained.

We visited the park the last week of June. We drove the Park Loop Road and stopped at the easier trails. We can't hike as far or as long as we use to, but there were plenty of trails around Sand Beach, Jordon Pond, Carriage Roads and Cadillac Mountain that we enjoyed. The vistas in this park are amazing! I hope we can return in the future.
Watch the sunrise and sunset from Cadillac Mountain. The beauty of the island is all around you. Take you time to enjoy the peace around you. Trails, trees and water. Nothing could be better.
There's so much to do I returned for a second visit, which I spent in the Mount Desert area of the park. Enjoyed hiking the trails and the beautiful scenery in this park. Well worth exploring!
Excellent views. Great parking. Plenty of picnic places to choose from.Fresh seafood and different modes of transportation bar harbor

We traveled to Bar Harbor by cruise ship in May, and made reservations for the bus tour of Acadia National Park online before we left. It was a short, but uphill hike from the tender dock to the bus. We had time to look around Bar Harbor before the bus left and enjoyed looking in the shops. The bus was not over-full but there weren't many empty seats. (If you want to do this tour, you probably ought to make your reservations well in advance) Since it started life as a school bus, leg room was minimal, but my bride has short legs and I sat by the aisle so we did fine. The drive to Acadia was pleasant. Once we entered the park, the scenery got even more spectacular. Our driver/guide knew A LOT about the area and freely shared his knowledge without being pushy. As we drove through the park we made several stops where we were able to walk out into the park and enjoy even more magnificent scenery. We're going back in the fall and have already purchased our tickets for our second trip into the park.

Beautiful National park with lovely mountains and the beautiful ocean. This is an amazing national park and would recommend for anyone who loves to be outdoors. Very nice facilities and well maintained trails.
A must see if you visit Maine. Absolutely beautiful! Make sure you visit Cadillac mountain, the views are something you remember for the rest of your life.

Cool summertime weather. Great for hiking or whale watching. Easy to drive around the park even during busy summer season. Less crowded that other famous NP's. Cadillac Mountain hike takes much of the day but is worth it. Bring sturdy hiking shoes.

We took a very challenging loop that was about five miles long and climbed two (approx 700 ft) mountains. The trails labeled strenuous really are! There was a lot of boulder climbing involveled, particularly climbing Acadia. The way down was easier and there were some rudimentary steps carved into the boulders but the direction we took was challenging. We have two very fit preteens who had no trouble with it, but I, the mama, struggled a bit. It was beautiful, smelled amazing, due to the trees and was really a step out of normal life. There were goorgeous views of Soames Sound from both peaks. There was nothing that looked like civilization and we saw very few (maybe 10 total) other people along the way. We just followed the blue paint spots, which weren't always easy to find, especially along the aptly named Ledge Trail.
The parks was just simply beautiful. The beach in the park was nice. The shuttle ride through the park was great and time saving if you didn't want to walk. A must see to enjoy.

This is one of my favorite places to be, so quiet, relaxing, scenic, and the ocean breezes are the best. Drove through the park and did some hiking. Make sure your there in the morning @ Cadillac Mtn for the early morning sunrise, You'll be the first in the US to witness this amazing sunrise. Stayed in Bar Harbor, did a 5 mile kayak trip...was a bit sore but a great experience. Just love this area of the country. Especially my lobstahs!!!

Spent a couple of days driving around the park and found some beautiful spots, including the biggest surprise which was a sandy beach (I understand these are quite rare on the Maine coast). Jordan Pond was a stunning as all of the pictures I had seen online and Thunder Hole a difference from the norm. Unlike many National Parks in the US (Yellowstone, Rock Mountain, Yosemite etc) I don't think this park is one to see wildlife, other that spotting the occasional beaver dam and a few sea birds. It's visually stunning though so well worth a first if you travel to the region. Only $20 entry fee as well so very reasonable pricing.
review_title: A beautiful National Park with diverse scenery

review_body: Beautiful views from any where in the park. Ocean Path and Otter Cliffs were my favorite spots. Sunrise on Cadillac Mountain @ 4:45am was amazing.. Three days in the area was not enough. Stayed in Bar Harbor, only minutes to the park.

We spent several hours hiking in Acadia. The views are amazing! Because I was with teenagers we took the more difficult trails that involved a lot of climbing, but there were trails for all abilities.

Absolutely breathtaking views and invigorating hikes. Our family of 15 LOVED every bit of Acadia. Favorites were Thunder Hole although we missed the 2 HR before high tide so it sounded more like a plunged toilet. The scenery was amazing. Jordan Pond was serene. We loved Otter Cliffs and Bubble Rock ( the later is quite the hike....felt that the next day!). Perfect for some awesome pictures and some funny trick photography. We highly recommend sunrise on Cadillac Mt.....heavenly. There were about 1000 people there but it was so quite and peaceful. Just beautiful! This is a must see

If you are an admirer of this nations natural splendor and rugged seashore is your thing, look no further - this place is nirvana. We stayed in Bar Harbor and had no problems with traffic or crowds in late June. The hiking and natural beauty is spectacular. In four days I did not see one piece of trash or one bit of graffiti anywhere. The staff here does a great job and everyone was so well behaved and respectful.
review_title: The best National Park on the East coast, and I've been to most of them.

review_body: Acadia is just beautiful. We drove around Park Loop Rd and up to the top of Cadiallac Mountain. Had popovers at Jordan Pond after many trials to get a parking space. We did not use the trolley or bus that takes you into the park. Parking is tight in popular areas like Sand Beach and Jordan Pond. Look for parking areas across road near Sand beach area on Park Loop Rd. Walked along the coast and lake. Very hot when we were there. Bring water. And a camera! Wear good shoes if walking on rocks and paths.

We brought our own bikes from home to ride around Eagle Lake. We were hoping to cover Jordan pond but it was a little farther than our family is used to biking. We took lots of water and had a great time. I highly recommend stopping at the Park Ranger center before you go to get a carriage trail map. They can tell you what is doable based on the abilities of your family.
review_title: Beautiful family-friendly bike ride around Eagle Lake

review_body: Hard to park and a bit crowded, but totally worth it. Get OUT of your car and hike the trails. Bike the carriage roads. It's worth it.
If your into hiking trails, this is the place to be. This is a very clean park, with many places to see what you think is the best scenery. Only to discover yet another amazing sight to see

A must see, add to your bucket list if it isn’t on there! The views are absolutely incredible and many hiking options available. We hiked Cadillac Mountain which can be a bit challenging but well worth it. A lesson learned - bring plenty of water!
Great hiking and views for everyone to enjoy. Great easy trails for any age to enjoy. Crowded in early July but everyone helpful and polite.
review_title: Family vacation in Bar Harbor & Park

review_body: I don't know what it is like to drive into the park personally, because we went with a tour. The park is very pretty, though we happened to be there on a very foggy day, so we didn't get to see the vistas as well as I would have liked. However, the whole park is meant to be a place to relax, enjoy nature, and get away for the hectic ness of life. In the, it is a huge success. It is so serene and relaxing. I recommend finding out about a tour to enjoy the carriage roads, since there are so many places you cannot go by vehicle.
A spectacular park with views of water and mountains and splendid hiking trails. We stayed for two days and it felt like we should have stayed longer.

We spent 1 1/2 days at this national park, and we were not disappointed. We arrived on day at 8am at the Hulls Cove Visitor Center, purchased the park pass, bought a few souvenoirs, and then proceeded on our entire day journey on the famous 27-mile Park Loop Road. We purchased an on-line tour guide for $5 (equivalent to the CD), which was nice. Each of the roughly 20 stops went from good to great. Great mountain views, rocky-shore lines, an amazing beach, the forest, and finished with the unbelievable views from the very top of Cadillac Mountain. You can walk/hike as little or as much as you want. On the 2nd day, we returned to the beach and spent a few hours in the rather cold ocean. This beach is surrounded by rocks/forest. I’ve seen nothing like it in the world. We will definitely return.

Alot of construction going to park. One way roads. Not enough parking. Not enough bathrooms. Long lines. Expensive for going for a day. Great if you are going for a week. Pass is 30. For a week. Beautiful park just alot of traffic and not enough parking. Great mountains and views.

National Parks are a national treasure and Acadia is no exception. It's a gorgeous park with many different places to explore. We focused on one. The Ocean Path at Acadia National Park is a beautiful trail along the water. It's a wonderful hike for kids who like to climb rocks and explore. The photos we took are gorgeous. But the hike is listed as EASY which it is not. I mean, it's not super steep, but there were a lot of older people on the path struggling with the exposed roots and unlevel rock stairs. Everything I read about it made it sound easy but it was hard for the grandparents in our group and for many of the other grandparents I saw hiking. Mostly our issue was my parents not realizing their new limitations, but I'm passing on this warning as I saw quite a few of the 70+ crowd struggling. My husband and I offered many hands to people who needed it.
review_title: National Parks are a national treasure and this one is no exception.

review_body: We have been here twice, once in the fall for the color change, this time in the summer for the beautiful green landscape. It is an absolutely beautiful p,ace to spend a day. There are many hiking trails and rock climbing opportunities. We went on a tour from our cruise, so we could no partake in those. Go, but be respectful of the rules in the park, they are for your safety and enjoyment of the park.
We absolutely loved it! Be careful of the Beehive! It’s a great trail, but you will be climbing a metal ladder up a cliff face!

Spent a day on Cadillac Mountain, drive to south end of park to lighthouse. And, one of the best things, $30 Park pass fee was free with my senior pass. Beautiful place, hiked to the Bubbles, well worth the time spent.
user_location: Surfside Beach, South Carolina, United States

review_body: We came here for a couple days. One cant miss experience is to watch the sunrise from the top of Cadillac mountain. Just warning to make sure you get there at least 30 minutes before scheduled sunrise to get entire experience. Plus its very very crowded.
W went to the park during our stay in Bar Harbor and it is a beautiful park with great hiking trails and a very nice beach, although a bit rocky!!
I'm Irish so rarely use the word "Awesome", this park is truly Awesome, especially Cadillac Mountain. This day was one of the highlights of our 2 week trip and I would really recommend.
The Park was beautiful, Cadillac mountain wondrous, the ferns were huge, and the trails very well marked. It was fun hiking along Acadia.

When it comes to beautiful scenary few states can rival Maine in the fall; and, few parks are more beautiful than Acadia. The hardwood trees of Maine are rich in color. The color of the park against the backdrop of the northern coast of Maine creates an unforgettable of the majestic and serene. The area allows the traveler to visit some of the grand lighthouses, lending the park and surrounding area a touch of New England in times past. Though too many souvenir shops and stores that cater to the many tourist are beginning to overwhelm Bar Harbor's main street, it remains a quaint picturesque town. Our favorite spot to visit remains Cadillac Mountain. In the fall the temperature atop the mountain can turn quickly cold. It is best to carry a windbreaker to weather the cold brusque wind. Still, the color of fall that spreads before the visitor for miles is breathtaking and worth enduring the cold wind. Never will you breath cleaner air.
Acadia is a very scenic park with many great scenic point accessible by vehicle. There are great trails for hiking and it is well maintained.

We did a lot of hiking in the park (walking boots recommended as can be unstable under foot sometimes and also have to clamber over and around large rocks) The landscape, lakes and scenery are stunning. If you are not so nimble on your feet anymore or have small children, you can take a trolley ride around certain parts of the park.
review_title: Fantastic place with so much to do and see

review_body: We visited Acadia for the first time and really enjoyed it. The staff was friendly and helpful. The park was very clean and beautiful. We walked around the shore and did some hiking. It was nice to drive around and sightsee with several spots to pull over along the road. It is a very beautiful national park. Can't wait to come back again!
review_title: First visit and won't be the last

review_body: Very interesting park with many stories associated with it's creation as it was built from several land donations. I highly recommend a tour to ensure you learn all about it.Numerous great views from Cadillac Mountain to Thunder Hole and many others. Allocate time for a tour as well as time on your own to experience on a relaxed timeline.I will definitely go back.

My first visit to Acadia, and not my last. It helped that we a the most perfect weather for 4 days in a row - no rain, just sunny and warm. Hiked the Goreham Mt trail and a few others. There's something for everyone = challenging mountain hikes to seaside strolling paths. Absolutely loved it.
review_title: Better than I could have imagined!

review_body: We had limited time on this New England road trip, so only had one day to spend in the park. No, that is definitely not enough time to see and do much! We decided to focus on the 27 mile loop drive and the sites along it. We started at the visitor center and were disappointed that there weren't many programs going on (during the week, just before high season) but appreciated the info and picked up a Junior Ranger activity book for our son. As others have mentioned, a very large majority of this drive is ONE WAY. My husband blew right by the first cluster of sites and there was no way to get back to it. At the end of the day, we considered heading back, but looked at the next available "bail out" spot and decided we didn't have time. Again, given that it wasn't quite high season, some of the activities required in the Junior Ranger book were difficult to achieve, but the friendly Ranger at the end of the day appreciated my son working several extra activities from the book to make up for the ability to do some of the other items. Even though it was still a couple of weeks from that high season and mid-week, it was rather busy. Plan to walk to some of the sites, parked outside of the main parking area. Our favorite spots were Thunder Hole, Sandy Beach and the top of Cadillac Mountain. The beautiful scenery alone makes this a must-do park!  Definitely worth a visit and we plan to do so with much more available time in the future so we can hike and bike!

Breathtaking views and plenty of areas for stopping to look (if you can find a parking spot). We were on a tour and got to stop at Cadillac Mountain and Thunder Hole for about 20 min each, both were well guarded, but still left opportunities to climb on the rocks and see the spectacular sights that Acadia has to offer. Amazing!

Acadia National Park offers a lot activities to enjoy.The views are spectacular especially from the top of Cadillac Mountain.There are multiple trails to enjoy for the amateur or avid hiker.There is a long line to buy entry tickets so the earlier you get there the better. The sunrise view on top of Cadillac mountain is a unique experience. There is a beautiful beach to enjoy.There are wildlife refuge areas .During the busy summer months, it may be better to use the Acadia shuttle bus system to navigate around the park.
review_title: So much to do and see

review_body: Beautiful national park with hiking trails and wonderful ocean views. Be sure to visit Thunder Hole. Some of the park roads are one way, so check your map before starting your drive through the park.

We took a cruise that stopped in Bar Harbor, and we decided to do a bus tour of Acacia National Park. It was a long tour (about 6 hours, including a stop for lunch), and yet we still could have used a little more, as our last few stops (Cadillac Mountain and the Wild Gardens) were a bit rushed.We stopped at various overlooks to explore and to take photos. I believe that our first major stop was Thunder Hole. Although there were a lot of people, there were so many places to explore that you could get away from just about everyone--most of my photos don't have anyone in them! We proceeded to Jordan Pond, which provided views of two smaller mountains known as the "Bubbles" (north and south). After lunch we headed up the winding road to the awe-inspiring Cadillac Mountain, with its incredible views of the Porcupine Islands. I definitely wish we had more time there! Our final stop was the Wild Gardens, where there was also a museum and natural center. Although this stop was nice, given the shortness of our visit, I would have preferred to spend more time exploring the mountain. Even better, it would have been nice to walk or bike the carriage trails, which don't allow motorized vehicles. Overall, however, we had a great time visiting the park and would highly recommend it!
review_title: Loved our visit to this amazingly scenic national park!

review_body: WOW!!!! One of the most beautiful places I've been. The views from Cadillac mountain are stunning. The walk across to Bar island Is a must do...so much so we did it in pouring rain. The Beehive and Brook trail to Sargent Mountain were difficult but well worth the sweat. Bass HarborHead Lighthouse was gorgeous too...make sure you do both vantage points. We wish we had 1 or 2 more days.
review_title: You need more than two days

review_body: This is my second time to Acadia National Park. It never changes, still one of the most beautiful parks in the United States. My wife and I have been to Yellowstone and it was amazing! But, with the water surrounding the mountains...Acadia is special in it's own way.It's where the Mountains meet the Ocean....simply Spectacular!
review_title: One of the Most Beautiful National Parks

review_body: Fantastic 360 degree views at top of mountain. Great man made walking trails; stay off anything growing. The foliage is beautiful and the history so interesting. We will definitely plan another trip here and stay longer. Bring a lot of dough; Bar Harbour is an expensive place to hang.

The park is beautiful! Very easy to drive around and make stops. You just pull off to the right side when you want to take in the views or get some photos. Plenty of trails and rocks to climb. Should you go to Jordan Pond the trail around the entire pond is about 4.5 miles (at least thats what our step tracker told us). The left entrance stars with 1.5 miles of wood plank walking. Then you climb over large rocks and the right side is pretty smooth. Very cool path, but just know what you're getting in to. We didn't read the sign very well and thought it'd be a short 1.5 trek :D No regrets as it was a very fun path. Then stop over at the Jordan Pond House for some yummy food.
review_title: Gorgeous views and a lot of fun

review_body: The park is great. I will definitely return. There is hiking and climbing for all levels. Be sure to get a map and read about the trails before starting your hikes. There is a great LLBean free shuttle bus that makes getting aroung the park easy.

We were in Acadia June 22-26, we thought this was early enough in the season to beat the big crowds, and the park was not at the levels of July-Aug crowds, we found most of the parking lots at hiking areas and at Sand Beach (a starting point for many hikes) full by 11 am. We adjusted and arrived at 9:30 am and found parking for the hikes. The park is beautiful and the hiking trails are the nicest we have been on, great number of moderate level hikes that are fabulous.

We decided to celebrate my bix Six Oh in Acadia National Park and what a splendid decision that was! Acadia National Park is unique in that it is on an island and Cadillac Mountain is reachable by car and has 360 degree views of the park! The park loop is spectacular with many stop off points and overlooks. Lovely, lovely views of inlets and the Atlantic ocean, a couple of large inland lakes inside the island! We were there only for a day but wished we had a week there! There is so much see and do and hike! Breathtaking is the best way to describe this place. Not to be missed!
review_title: Lovely lovely park! Not to be missed! Fall colors would have been even more spectacular but summer is no slouch either!

review_body: Acadia is an amazing park. The drive along Park Loop Road is only about 27 miles long but there are several points to pull off on to enjoy the various scenic views and trails. It took us most of the day driving the loop, but it was so enjoyable. The views are breathtaking of the coastline.
We spent 3 consecutive days at the park, experiencing breathtaking views and going on fun and challenging hikes. We could have spent an entire week and not repeated any experience.

Great views throughout the park. Much less crowded than we expected. Don't miss sunset on Cadillac Mountain, but dress warm. A variety of things to see and do. Be in good shape if you rent/bring bikes with you.
review_title: Wonderful Views and plenty to do

review_body: The park is just breath taking. Spent hours there. Views are unbelievable. There is a bike trail for those interested. We saw people kayaking.

Bucket list park with tons of things to do. Loved the hiking and the wonderful scenery. Injured my knee half way through the trip but was still able to enjoy the park as it is so accessible. Quiet side of Acadia is definitely worth the drive. Acadia lived up to it’s reputation as a top National Park. Can’t wait to return!!

First, we had a picture perfect day. That really helps.Second, the Visitors Center was great. Car pass and information in quick order. Very efficient.The 27 mile drive is easy and pleasant. Spent a lot of time on the top of Cadillac Mountain. The views are superb and the facilities first rate. One draw back. Lots of people and parking is an issue, but patience pays off.Love the coast line. Needed more time.
Incredibly beautiful. Great scenery on the park loop road. Plenty of places to stop and take pictures

My husband and I went up to Bar Harbor for our baby moon. We frequently go to Maine for little getaways when we are sick of the city. Acadia National Park is so beautiful! It was the last big tourist week of the season during our visit. The last cruise ship was docked in Bar Harbor. The park itself was pretty busy. Just getting the pass for your car was kind of difficult. They were all sold out at a couple of the stations but we managed to get one. The park- so beautiful! The roads and walkways are well kept. The park rangers are friendly and helpful with any questions or concerns. We saw so much wildlife, trees in peak colors, and buses full of tourists. Magical place, can’t wait to go back during the summer.
Craggy rocks of joyAmerica's best idea!!!Trees, seas, and mountainsIf you like good thingsYou will like AcadiaBecause it is greatProse: I like this place
review_title: A Review in Haiku from Me to You

review_body: Glad we made it a point to stop here. Cadillac Mt. views were superb. We stopped at the beach which was a nice treat with clear water and waves. A fun afternoon.
review_title: A must see in Bar Harbor.

review_body: Went to the top of Cadillac Mountain on a recommendation from Sean at Gallagher’s Travels. Absolutely breathtaking sunset!
Must visit place. The road, places everything is very beautiful and quite. I recommend minimum 2 day stay at this park to enjoy everything.

If you are in this area and don't get to go, shame on you! It is a beautiful park with many options to see it. Drive yourself, trolley tours from Bar Harbor and other escorted tours. If you want to get out and hike different areas, probably best to drive yourself. We did a week pass and spent three days at the park. If nothing else do the loop and drive it around just stopping at the specific tour stops. If you have the time, get out and hike areas to see more off the beaten path views. All different levels of fitness for trails are marked. The natural beauty is just astounding.
Must go to the top of Cadillac mountain to watch the sunrise and sunset great views. The old stone bridges are great. Drive the loop road.

Did this excursion while on a cruise. The park and mountain were beautiful! The narrated tour was excellent. We stopped for an included lobster lunch at The Lobster Bake that was delicious. Steaks were available if you don't like lobster and heard they were very good as well. Excellent excursion!

We loved Acadia and wished we had more time to see the park. We hiked the Beehive Trail and went to Sand Beach. The Beehive Trail was just right for our girls who are 16 and 13. They enjoyed climbing up the iron rungs and steep cliffs. It’s totally worth the climb for the view! This hike would not be suitable for small kids or anyone with a fear of heights.
We visited the park on a bus tour. We have been before solo but the bus tour is well worth it, there is a lot of explanation. The park is beautiful,, well worth visiting

We visited the park and took the tour on Ollie’s trolley.Our driver Lucy was excellent—a great driver,very well informed with a great sense of humor.I was pleasantly surprised the park was not crowded.We thoroughly enjoyed our trip.
review_title: The most gorgeous scenery I have ever seen

review_body: This was probably the most crowded national park that we have visited, but it is a beautiful park. Jordan Pond, Cadallic Mountain, Thunder Hole, etc. are all worth visiting. With a toddler, we did not hike as much as I would like, but their are several nice moderate to easy hiking trails.

We started the day with the view from Cadillac Mountain, and drove the park loop. We hiked a few places along the route. The views everywhere are beautiful. The rocky coast and mountains make this a very different beach than we’d ever seen.
There is so much to do in Acadia. Lots of hikes and lookouts. Don't overlook the seemingly uninteresting parts, they end up being the most fascinating!

We are lovers of western national parks, especially Rocky Mountain NP. So, when we decided to visit Maine, I was expecting to be disappointed. I was VERY wrong! Acadia NP is stunningly beautiful with so many different experiences. We have been here a week and barely scratched the surface. We will definitely return in a few years!

We always head out West to get our Park fix on, but we were THRILLED to find such an unexpected TREASURE!!! We purchased a car pass for 7-days for our family at the little visitor center in town and although only there 2 days, got our monies worth. If you are adventurous and can do only 1 hike, do Beehive Trail!!!! If you have more time, Cadillac Mountain, of course, as well! If you are unable to hike at all, drive to Cadillac Mountain and simply get out and enjoy the lovely views!

There was a catastrophic fire that started in the dump and spread across most of the island in 1947, destroying most of the homes of the super-affluent elite and a majority of the trees on the island. The parks department over the years has planted new trees and the land is most beautiful.We came across sandy beaches that have a nice corse ground sand from the centuries of indians clam fishing / feasting on the clams in the bay.The rich and the famous built butiful homes on the island before the park was developed and some of them are still here.At low tide in he harbor we observed sand bars that show up and link the main island to the surrounding Porcupine smaller islands (reason the town is called Bar Harbor.There are four towns on the island and a total of 10,000 population with ½ of that number living in Bar Harbor. The ranger noted the population on the island jumps to around 35,000 in the peak season of summer.
Great experience with the Oli tour group—Cadillac Mountain was a total must see//Thunder hole also a must stop Beautiful beautiful!!!!

Acadia is Maine's jewel. The park's loop road gives access to incredible viewpoints, trails and vistas. Be sure to head up Cadillac Mountain, visit Sandy Beach, stop to view the blow hole in stormy conditions, and generally get out of the car every chance you can to see all the incredible scenery.
review_title: Acadia is Maine's jewel of a National Park.

review_body: We only had one day. We had the load of a CD so we could follow a route through the park and gain much knowledge. The geography is amazing. It was fairly busy so we did not stop at every site; therefore we have reason to return.
Come for more than one day and stop and every place you can and drink in the amazing beauty of this place!!! Words can not describe it!
review_title: Everything about this place is awesome!!

review_body: Acadia is spectacular. We did the two mile walk around Jordan Pond and it was fantastic. Parts of the walk can be difficult, as you have to traverse a few hundred yards of boulders, but it is well worth it. At the end of the hike you lunch at the Jordan Pond House Restaurant. If ever there was a must do, this is one. Eat there and you will know why. We also drove to the top of Cadillac Mountain and enjoyed some of the most beautiful views anyone could want.

We stayed in Bar Harbor for several days, and went to the park many times during our visit. It is simply beautiful and so easily accessible by car. I would highly recommend driving up to the top of Cadillac Mountain to see the sunset - it was the highlight of our trip!

Came as a birthday trip, and was amazed. $30 entry per car. Favorite spots were Jordan Pond Trail, Sand Beach/Ocean Trail, Cadillac Summit at Sunrise, North Ridge Trail, Thunder Hole, and the Carriage Trails!

My husband and I recently came to Acadia for a 3 night stay. What a gem of a national park. While small, Acadia is spread out over several areas of the park and has a ton to offer. First off, the park is beautiful! From oceans to bays to rocks to forests and flowers, there is a variety to look at and explore. There are hikes to suit all different levels of skill and they are varied. The park is also extremely clean and well maintained. There is a definite pride in this park. I'm not sure how much of this has to do with it being smaller and us going at the very early beginning of "tourist" season, but this was the cleanest and best maintained park we have visited yet (and we have hit about half). We loved both the Mount Desert portion of the park, as well as the much quieter Winter Harbor/Schoodic peninsula. We walked many trails, went on a few longer hikes, completed the driving loops, and even did the 2 hour bridge carriage tour. Loved it all!
review_title: Great trip to a beautiful national park

review_body: We hiked a few places in Arcadia, the scenery is wonderful, we had great weather, we especially liked Jordan Lake and the hike from the beach to otter cliffs

Covered much of the park in two days. Kayaking was the top. Hiking was good as there are paths for all ages. Beaches are clean...as is the whole park, tourists do a good job cleaning up after themselves. Good vacation spot mixing the rugged with the hipster spots in Bar Harbor for evening entertainment. One thing is be prepared for the mosquitoes. We were kayaking in a good breeze for hours and made our way to land for a quick break and drink. Got out of kayak and immediately was swarmed by the little blood suckers. Jumped back in kayak and paddled out to a breeze to be free. Really enjoyed the trip with my teen son, this Fall will bring my bride for a carriage ride. One thing we wanted to do was horseback but nothing available on the island.
review_title: Mini Park With Lots to Do

review_body: This is a must see, bucket list type of place. It was absolutely amazing, the views, the trails, everything was great. A pass will last 7 days, but we only stayed for 3, and still so much that we didn't see. We just can't say enough about this place

Beautiful park with so many outdoor activities to do. Did 30 miles of hikes in 4 days and wanted more. Bar harbors a nice little nearby town. Early June weather was great, no bugs, not too crowded either...Go!

This is one of the most beautiful National Parks we've visited. We only had a partial day there, so it was a drive through for us, stopping at many of the pull off places and parking areas. But time spent there was worth it.

We visited the Bar Harbor, Maine & Acadia national park area in early May with good weather & pre summer crowds. We did the loop drive, went up to Cadillac Mountain, went to Bass Harbor Head lighthouse, & hiked near the Bubbles. Friendly and helpful park rangers at the visitor center. Not a true wilderness national park but worth the visit.
review_title: Great visit before the summer crowds

review_body: We hiked in Acadia National Park last week and were there to watch the sunrise on Cadillac Mountain. This park is just wonderful. The views are truly breathtaking. We were just there last week and it was quite chilly in the morning. Anyone coming from warmer weather should keep that in mind. It was in the 40's at sunrise. The park has great signage to help you navigate through it. This is a peaceful, lovely park with views that you'll remember forever.

The park is truly a treasure. There are so many places to sight see, shop, and hike. To my surprise, there were more that 100 people at Sandy Beach. The water was under 60 degrees, but it was quite refreshing. Don't stop until you reach the top. The view of Bar Harbour from there is outstanding!

I recently returned from my husband's family's vacation. All of the trips have centered around a national park. This year, Acadia National Park was the destination. This was my first trip to Maine and I have to admit, I thought it would be hard to top Glacier National Park from 2 years ago, but Acadia is truly a gem. It's small and easy to get around. Many of the trails are easy to do with small kids and "older" kids. There are lots of activities in and out of the park. The scenery is spectacular! Fly into Bangor, Bar Harbor is an easy 55 minute drive. There are many places ranging in price to stay.
Definitely plan to go in the off season as it can be very busy. However, the views are spectacular. The carriage trails roads are great for hiking. Most of the sites are accessible by car.
Lovely spot. Took an Uber to the top of Cadilac mountain. Beautiful view on a clear day. Quiet, scenic and peaceful.

Wife & I holidaying for 2 months in U.S. Stayed with friend in Maine for 5 days she took us hiking in Acadia & what beautiful views there are. The trees were just starting to change colors for your Autumn so our photos are beautiful.

Ended up on a small bus tour of the park, including the summit with the views of the overall harbor and islands and the touristy overlooks along the coast. Showed up on the best day they have had in a month the guide said, with fantastic visibility. I'm rarely disappointed at a National Park, but this one stood out for it's combo package and sea and forest. Would definitely like to come back for some hiking. Well done NPS!

We visited on a day which was warm but dull however that didn't detract from all the beautiful viewpoints around the park. We did the Beehive Trail but followed the easier climb to the summit. Still requires a bit of stamina for the gradual climb. WOW was it worth it - the panoramic views were amazing. Admire those that took the trail close to the rock face with a sheer drop and assisted by some metal bars. No safety harness or safety nets in sight - you do the walk, you take the risk, seems fair to me. Virtually each turn on the road revealed another picture taking moment. Nature at its best.
This is one beautiful park ! Plenty of parking for picture opportunities. Its dog friendly too . Beautiful...

This had been on my bucket list too long - we finally made it - and it was everything we had hoped for. Nature has created a spectacular island of beauty for us to enjoy. You can drive the loop around the park to get a sampling of everything. We took the loop the 2nd day & 3rd day to stop, get out of our car and hike the many beautiful trails. Bring your hiking shoes or a good pair of sneakers - you will want to walk till you drop. Loved this place.

We spent one day driving loop road and stopping at Jordons Pond, Sand Beach, And Cadillac Mountain. I recommend wearing a jacket, even though it is summer we were cold. The view from cadillac Mountain was breath taking.
Incredibly beautiful. There are so many places in Acadia to visit that our three days there seemed to be too short.
I honestly can't think of how this place could get anything less than 5 stars. Perfect in every way.
We love our National parks - but this one is amazing. There is something for everyone at Acadia. Easy strolls, strenuous hikes, breathtaking views, amazing wildlife.
My daughter and I spent the day at sand beach, it was so pretty and very clean. Not overly crowded, had a very nice day there.

Good park . I spent two days in the park and enjoyed it . First day we couldn't do much work in our junior ranger programs because they didn't have pencils for the kids to work with . We are avid jr rangers, make sure to bring your own pencils. The loop is one way ( worst part I think ) so make sure to pay attention where you're going and what your agenda Is and timing because if you pass it ..you'll be out of luck for 30 some miles again . The sign said sand beach was full twice ..and both times the parking lot was almost empty, it would be nice if that sign was updated every once in a while. There is alot of construction by the hulls entrance /bar harbor entrance and that was a pain as navigation wasn't utd and the stop light that controls the four way stop sign before the entrance isn't working so it's a mess . The trees and sand beach were beautiful but otherwise nothing special and one of the least educational nps I've been to (21st location ) . It's definately worth seeing if you have a NPS pass and in the area .

So many scenes to take in. A parking lot might be full, but when you find a trail, it is complete quiet. You almost feel like no one else is around! Then you'll come to a pass where the ocean is on the side, absolutely beautiful!!

Best done over several days but can crunch the major sights into one day drive. The traffic was a amazing even though still "off season". Not many bikers on main loop road but must remain wary as they are there. Making much of loop one way definite plus for those who want to stop and enjoy versus those always in a hurry.

A small National Park that can be covered in a day. Unfortunately, the weather did not cooperate and we could see nothing on Cadillac Mountain. Nice lunch at the Jordan Pond teahouse. The carriage roads are nice, but I noted that what nice views of Jordan Pond there may have been from the carriage roads when they were build, are now all obstructed by the aging forests.

I am writing this from the point of view of a day hiker (about 300 miles annually). Acadia is outstanding in that there are options with fantastic views for all levels from easy to very strenuous with ladders and narrow ledges. You have views everywhere of ocean, ocean cliffs, streams, lakes, harbors, mountains, etc. All within a relatively small area. The thing to know here is that, unlike most hike areas, the mountain hikes are short and straight up the granite slope. Scrambling up boulders, rocks, stairs and ladders. The other good thing as the there are a multiple trail options to chain together a few shorter hikes into longer loops. For example Gorham, Bowl, Beehive and Ocean trails form a 7 mile loop with moderate beginning up Gorham , challenging middle at Beehive and easy finish on the Ocean trail…all with great views!
Super National Park- crowds were minimal- trails were enjoyable especially Jordan Lake - Cadilac Mountain was great late in the day-view was spectacular.

Don't miss Acadia. It's beautiful and there are so many hiking trails. We drove around the first day and on day two, we did several hikes. It's $30 a day per car; but then they tell you that the pass is good up to a week. So, we went back in with no charge on the second day.

I wasn't sure what to expect coming to Acadia, but I'm so glad we spent a few days there! The hiking is unlike other national parks I've been too, we were rock scrambling on many of the hikes we did, it wasn't just flat gravel trail. The kids in our group loved this! The views at the tops of the mountains we hiked were incredible (but you'll want to hike on a clear day). We were here early June and had no problems finding parking, and there were no crowds to speak of. We spent about three days here and camped in the park, and I felt like that was enough time to hit most of the highlights, but I will be coming back to Acadia in the future!
review_title: One of my favorite national parks!

review_body: Apparently the fifth smallest of the national parks by land area but one of the top 10 most visited! Gorgeous scenery but only giving it a 4 star as I have been to better and I think the hype about the place, I expected more. The part you pay your $30 fee (which I think is a bit steep), is the bit with the loop drive. Although you can get on at different sections and avoid the main gates, don't think you can avoid the fee. We saw the rangers actively looking at each car to see if the pass was displayed and waiting patiently, blocking any cars in with their trucks, who did not have a ticket. Would advise you to take drinks and food in with you although there is a restaurant at Jordan Pond House (we did not realise and came off at Seal Harbour hoping to find a small cafe, desperately wanting an ice cream - by the way there is a small restaurant there and a cafe next door which was closed). The restaurant at Jordan Pond was very busy (it was Saturday but not yet high season), so you had to put your name down for a table. If you do not want to wait there is a grab and go section above the gift shop for drinks,, and small choice of ice cream, they may have had sandwiches but by the time we got there there was nothing left. Unlike most of the national parks we have been to, there was no newspaper listing in detail some popular walks in order of difficulty. I somehow felt that they were wanting you to buy the walking maps but we only had the day so was not worth it. Would recomend you either buying the maps or researching ahead and printing off some basic maps. The main walk that everyone seemed to do was the Sand beach to Otter Point. 4.4 miles total round trip. Although it looked really nice with the views just felt that it was a little boring, a lot or most of it was walking along a path next to the main road and then walking back again. We were here on Saturday the 9th of June and I think the free buses started around the 23 of June to sometime in September so I would imagine it would be manic with people and cars during the period of time. You also have the cruise ship people and coaches to contend with as well! Just a tip, they had signs up saying some of the main parking lots were full and people were parking miles down the road, try the parking lots, when we got there we managed to find spaces quite easily and saves the boring walk along the road. Going up Cadillac Mountain for the view was definitely worth the trip, amazing views (take a jacket as even on a nice day it can be rather breezy up there.
review_title: Lovely, but the hype made me expect more!

review_body: This park is breathtaking! It is just the most beautiful place we have ever traveled to and there is so much to see and do.

A few years ago, I had never even heard of Acadia National Park (and I just turned 62), but I am very happy that my wife and I took the time to visit. We were visiting Cape Cod and took the long drive there, but it was worth every mile and hour that it took to get there. It was chilly in early June when we got there, but it was amazing. It was misty/rainy and 45 degrees when we went after an early dinner. Because of the nasty weather, we saw very few others in the park or on the road. We stopped at Thunder Hole and because the surf was kicking up, the hole was booming. I got some great pictures, although I missed out on taking sunset and night skies pictures because of the cloud cover, but that just gives me another reason to go back up there. I am not a hiker, but I know there are some great hikes in Acadia. I did take some great pictures, including some the next day of Jordan Pond after we had popovers. It you appreciate the magnificence and beauty of this incredible earth, you must visit Acadia National Park.
So much to see and explore, we only experienced a small part of the park and will be back for sure!!

Whether you are young or old there is plenty to see and do here. Take the loop road tour or go to the top and see the views from Cadillac Mountain.Get a bike and see the carriage trails or take one of the horse drawn carriage rides through the same. Many hikes available in all parks of the park from easy to expert!
review_title: Plenty of hikes and things for all abilities

review_body: A national treasure! There are so many ways to enjoy this park that belongs to all of us taxpayers that it is impossible to list them. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. They can guide you to those places that interest you and your family. This park is huge so plan to devote sufficient time to enjoy all its wonders.
This park is beautiful. I did not expect it to be as beautiful as it is. If you are not hiking, the park can be done in on every day. If you are hiking, give yourself several days.

This was on my bucket list to see and I was not disappointed. The views from Cadiallic mountain were fantastic, the shore walk fun and exciting, the 3 mi,e trail along Jordan pond was a little rough but I did it!
review_title: Amazing National park with so much to do!

review_body: My family and I had such an amazing time in Acadia. We were there for two full days, and it rained the majority of the time, but we still had an amazing time hiking and taking in the sites. We loved watching the waves crash on the shore, the sites of the harbor, and the beautiful views. Everyone should go to Acadia!

Beautiful park! Did the park loop road and stopped everywhere we could. Favorites for our family..Beaver Dam Pond,Sand Beach, and Cadillac Mountain. 27 miles took us all day..saw a barred owl, a deer, bald eagle, lots of other birds. Scenery was amazing!
Did 4 days of hiking here. The park is so clean and beautiful. The trails do have a lot of rocks and boulders to go over, so choose wisely.

Maine is such a beautiful state and Acadia National Park exemplifies the green and lushness of the area. I wanted to hug every single tree. So pretty! The park is also easily navigable, whether you choose to drive, hike or bike through it. We drove to the top of Mount Cadillac and also chose to hike around Jordan's Pond. The weather was cool in early June, but perfect, and the views are stunning.
Very enjoyable National Park. Great scenery. Friendly and efficient staff. Very clean and well maintained.

Arcadia National Park is a natural jewel. Thank you to the wealthy donors that graciously donated the land for one of the most beautiful of our national parks. Suggest that you take the trolley tour as their guides are well informed and eager to share their knowledge of the park. Our guide, Jim, is especially well educated in the park history and lore.
I can't believe we waited so long to come here--fabulous park; helpful signage (though carriage roads are a bit tricky to locate at first). We loved the biking!

This was my family's first trip to Acadia, but it won't be our last. We were only here for two and a half days (plus we had other activities planned in Bar Harbor) and it rained the third day, so we did not get to do all of the hikes we had planned. My 14 year old son, 12 year old daughter, husband and I we able to easily hike the Gorham Mountain Trail as well as the Great Head Trail including the jaunt to Sandy Beach. The views were absolutely stunning! Both trails were appropriately rated as "moderate." However, my husband had not been to a park with actual rock hiking trails, so the difficulty was a little more than he expected. We saved Wonderland Trail and Ship Harbor Trail (our favorite of the two) for the rainy day because we read there were less rocks making it less slippery. We made sure the tide was out when we hiked. The kids loved looking in the tide pools. The only thing was we had to limit going out on the rocks near the ocean because they were slippery.I highly recommend stopping at Hulls Cove Visitor's Center and purchasing a waterproof map as well as taking pictures of the high and low tide times. Also, I wish I had purchased hiking boots for the moderate trails. I wore running trail shoes, but the stiffness of hiking shoes with the ankle support would have been better.

I loved everything about Acadia. There's hiking trails for every level. A beautiful park loop drive that I would suggest doing first thing when you arrive to really get a taste of the park. The views from Cadillac Mountain were gorgeous. We were fortunate to go the week after Memorial Day and it was surprisingly not busy.
We drove through Acadia Park and went on top of Cadillac Mountain. The views were unbelievable. We stopped at almost every lookout and it just got better and better.

This was my family’s first time at Acadia. We visited Zion, Bryce, and Grand Canyon last summer so were on a National Park kick. Acadia was different but just as beautiful. Our first night, we drove up Cadillac Mtn to watch the sunset. It was pretty crowded up there...hard to find a parking spot. There were other places along the trail we could’ve pulled over to capture the sunset too. The next day we hiked Sand Beach which was an easy flat trail. Great for the whole family and even young children could hike it. For those who preferred hanging out at the beach, you can at the foot of the trail where the restrooms and water filling station is. After that, my family did Beehive which was harder. There’s one part that is steep with meta bars. My adult children did that and had no problems but I was a little scared (fear of heights) so hubby and I took the longer way around. Great view from the top. The next few days we hiked Penobscot which has a spectacular view. It wasn’t the easiest but not the hardest either. Longer than some of the other trails. And the start was by Jordan Pond House. One thing I noticed were the black flies. They were annoying. We didn’t encounter any on the beach trail but this one had a lot. We were told that it was because the flies are near the pond. So be forewarned. Bring bug spray or a netting for your head. You can buy bug spray at the store but not sure how expensive it is. Stopped off on the way back to eat popovers at Jordan Pond House. The wait wasn’t too bad but the popovers were very enjoyable. Our final day was a hike to Bubble Rock and Bubble trail. Not difficult either but sightly narrow and there are some steep steps where only one person can go at a time. Overall, we had a great time although we didn’t cover as much as we liked. Also Precipe trail was closed as birds were nesting. Quite different from the parks out West but just as lovely and smaller in scale. I told my family that the parks out west are massive and grandiose but Acadia is unique that it is by beautiful lakes and beaches. Would definitely go again.
We're not hikers or bikers but enjoy going to the park every year. Just driving the loop allows us to unwind. View from Cadillac Mountain is fantastic and every visit we go to Sand Beach.

To me how much someone will enjoy Acadia is based off of what other travel an individual has done. The park is well organized, trails are well documented, and the signage to navigate the park is outlined very well. The park is very beautiful with many different hiking trails and a variety of wildlife. Having said that, there are a lot of tour buses due to the cruise ships which made sightseeing impossible in the event you ended up where the tour buses dropped off. Being fortunate to travel to other countries and experience hiking trails and nature activities, Acadia was just average to me. If I lived closer I would definitely take advantage to being able to get out on some hiking trails and proximity to great seafood. Having traveled almost a the same time it would take to get to Europe I'd rather spend my time visiting other cultures.

The park was nice, rangers were helpful, maps were excellent. The views were pretty, but not magnificent; most of it was like a drive through the country, but there are quite a few ocean shots, but the parking there is tough. We were surprised at the LACK of wildlife. I guess I was expecting too much, but the only birds (we saw) were sea gulls and black birds; the only animals we saw was a little snake. I was hoping to see an eagle or osprey and maybe some dolphins in the sea. There are many hiking trails which are really nice and I advise you get out take some - stretch your legs and breathe some nice fresh air. The air was fresh and clean, we liked that. We went over Memorial Day and the weather was COOL (50 degrees), so we really couldn't appreciate a sunrise or sunset, nor could we 'star-gaze', which we really wanted to do. We spent about 10 minutes on Cadillac Mountain and left - too cold. Keep this in mind for future visits; cooler weather limits what you can do if you are adverse to cooler weather. Due to the cooler weather, it was NOT very busy at the park, but it was an issue parking at Cadillac Mountain and many overlooks. I can see that in nice weather, this place would be a zoo and you'll be driving around a lot. Much of the park is one-way, so if you want to return to a spot that you couldn't find parking the first time, you're going MANY miles around to get back there.

We were here in the off season, so the park itself wasn't busy. This is probably one of my favorite National parks. We probably spent 2 hours driving and getting out and checking out the views. Sand Beach was beautiful with the beach and pine trees. If you have time drive to the top of Cadillac Mountain. We will return, i have recommend Acadia to several people.
Just beautiful!!! Our 6th time visiting!! The views never get old. Some traffic but we did come on Memorial Day weekend so lots of people are to be expected

This is a must when visiting Maine. The view ms are spectacular along with the drive around the park we spent all day driving around and stopping at all the places to hike and see. We had lunch at the restaurant and the food and staff were excellent. Make sure you stop along the drive at every point to see the beautiful scenery views from Cadillac mountain are awesome.
Amazing we rode for miles just so much to see and do loved seeing all the views from the top of mountain and looking down the colors
Drove the park loop road several times, hiked several trails and even got up at 4 a.m. to go see sunrise on Cadillac Mountain (worth the effort)
If you are up to the long drive to "downeast" Maine, this is is a great collection of natural beauty. Don't miss Sand Beach and climbing Beehive mountain.
Acadia National Park was beautiful. We were there for a week. Each day was a new adventure. Such a beautiful place to go.... we will hopefully be returning!

Get out and walk around, see the views from different sides, so very beautiful. We ate lunch up There on the top of Cadillac mountain gazing at the beautiful views and then came back to view the sunset. Depending on the time of year dress for the cooler evening. We were here in May and it got very chilly. The good thing about coming in May is there are WAY less people than in the summer and we had comfortable temps during the day. Be sure to walk the trail between Sandy beach and otter cliff....easy walk with fantastic views!!!

If you have a fear of heights, the Beehive Trail is not for you. We were so glad that we did it though. The trail was invigorating with its hand/foot rails. The views were outstanding. There was a group of 52 French high school students hiking in front of us. Those were very brave leaders...

Don’t just go for the scenery. Get out of your vehicle and hike into the area to get a true feel of what the park is about. I got a list online of the degree of difficulty of the trails so we knew ahead of time where we were going to walk. There is also a trail map you can purchase at Hull’s Cove visitor’s center. Maps of the carriage paths are free in just about any gift shop in the park. The paths are very well maintained and pet friendly. We went in May and were concerned about black flies but there was not one in the 2 days we were there. The weather happened to be seasonal and just fantastic. This was a great time of year to go, in May because it’s before the summer crowds and fall leaf-peepers. It wasn’t crowded and we were free to roam wherever we wanted with ease and found parking places with no problem.
Our group of 5 cruise ship travelers would have loved to spend more time in Bar Harbor and Acadia National Park. It is just beautiful I hope to return and ride the network of carriage roads.

Maine-the way life should be. The park is gorgeous, especially on a sunny day. We drove the circle and also up the top of Cadillac Mountain. We were confused about the one way system at one point, so went back the second day for what we had missed. Fortunate to see a falcon we think flying around our Subaru.
Can't say enough good things about Acadia. It was a bucket list destination and it didn't disappoint. Wonderful, well-marked hiking and rock climbing, roads, star gazing and scenery.
We rented bikes and road the well groomed carriage roads from north to south in a big loop. Long but gentle grades took us by beautiful lakes through shady woods.

Acadia National Park is one of those must see places. Thunder hole, Cadillac Mountain & all the other areas are amazing and exceeded expectations. We took a tour on a limo bus which was both very informative and interesting. Can’t wait to go back.
Hadn't been to the park in over 15 years and its in great condition. Had a great visit to Jordan House and Cadillac and did the entire Loop Road, seeing 3 deer in less than 15 minutes.
review_title: Maine gem, one of a kind experience

review_body: The entire park is great - spectacular views abound. Be sure to drive all over the park, including the side roads. You never know what you will see. Wear sensible, comfortable shoes, since you will be walking around to see the sights. Use common sense - wear a hat and sunscreen (and bug repellant in warmer weather). TAKE SUNGLASSES! The glare off the water can be fierce at certain times of the day. Take snacks and drinks with you, so you don't have to leave the park to get food. There are many picnic areas with wonderful views.

We absolutely love it here and it's something you can do if you have a few hours time or days depending what you want to explore. As you can take your car and see the highlights and amazing views or of course hike the trails. The park is pristine and the views are amazing. This was a quick driving trip to see the highlights and I enjoy it just as much on by fourth trip as my first.
We loved it all. Highlights were Cadillac at sunset, and the beehive loop! May was a great month to visit. Not too busy or hot.

The beauty is everywhere you look. It is incredible. From the hiking trails to the paths along the water. Did a lot of rock scrambling. Mother nature never fails to impress. I'll be back to see and do something new,
review_title: Been here before, never tire of the beauty.....

review_body: We were able to spend the time driving around and visiting various view points and paths. It is a beautiful and rewarding experience. We would highly recommended this for a vacation destination.

Beautiful National Park. We stayed four days with three nights at the Blackwood campgrounds. There is so much to do here. We hiked, took photos and tried the local restaurants. They have trails all over along with a park loop for those wanting the views and prefer to drive. Offer kayaking, bikes, boat tours. Didn’t have time to explore the towns but will definitely be back to do that. Recommend at least one sunrise, we barely made it to a 5:16 am one. A must so add it to your list!

Be sure to drive in the right direction because it is oneway and you will have to backtrack.. Seniors remember your National Park pass or the cost is $25. Take your time and go in early or late season or it will be too crowded!

I have lived in Los Angeles for 45 years and have been to San Franciso several times, so I know something about traffic obviously, and I have been to 33 National Parks, 30 U.S. states and 10 countries. The drive on the 3 from about Ellsworth down to Acadia is the WORST drive I have ever done. The speed limit through tiny towns is artificially already very low, and then local people and tourists drive way below that. You get stuck behind trucks and terrible drivers for hours on a single lane road. The drive was so bad we illegally passed several cars over the 90 minutes it took to drive only a few miles into the park. It's high time that Maine build a direct highway route with higher speed limits directly to Acadia instead of being stuck in the horrible dumpy towns you must drive through. Once we were in Acadia NP, the directional signs weren't very good at all! And the Acadia NP map we got at the entrance just showed a "park loop," when the lighthouse and other things to see are "out of the loop." The map isn't labeled very well either. The park loop was very nice and not that big- we did it in a couple of hours, but it's probably better to go in the summer and during Fall leaf change. We saw zero animals. We were there May 1 and it was cold and damp!
review_title: Drive on the 3 from Ellsworth down to Acadia and back north is the WORST drive EVER!!!!

review_body: We have visited Acadia for decades and during many seasons. This is a special place to visit over and over again. It is a unique National Park because it is also part of a community. The people of Bar Harbor make this place warm and inviting. Everyone can find something to do at any season here. Hiking, walking, horse back riding and bicycle riding on well maintained trails with unbelievable views of forest and ocean during warm weather. Cross country skiing if there is snow Or just enjoying getting away for a brief winter vacation. If you plan on visiting ME you must visit Acadia. Be sure to include Schoodic Point on the mainland just a short drive north or take a ferry to the beautiful quiet place and watch the pilot whales swim in the ocean the the mountain of Acadia as the background. There are so many things to do here you will never get bored bring you kayak,SUP or canoe and enjoy the pristine lakes too.
review_title: Most beautiful place on ME coast

review_body: We love to visit National State Parks and Acadia National Park is among the most beautiful places we have visited. There is so much to do. We loved Jordan Pond and the Park Loop Road. The foliage was beautiful and added to the autumn feeling.
review_title: Autumn in Acadia is a must!

review_body: The first things most people see in Acadia National Park are Sand Beach, Thunder Hole and the other features along the Loop Drive outside of Bar Harbor. BTW - see these early in the morning and you may share the experience only with seagulls and eagles - as close to wild as you can get on the Atlantic coast. But there's so much more to the park. The Schoodic section and the parts of the park on the islands are arguably even more beautiful and certainly not so overrun with people during the summer months. Tide tables will tell you the times of incoming tides - best for dramatic views of surf along the rocky coast. Enjoy, and then come back in the winter just after a storm and you'll see really big waves and surf-spray!
review_title: Acadia is so much more than the Loop Drive

review_body: Absolutely stunning national park. Going to the top of the mountains and looking out on the coast through the clouds was an unforgettable experience

This park is absolutely terrific in all ways possible. You can wander around all day and never get bored of the sights. We found a cave that fills with water that was incredibly interesting, we trekked the more difficult trails and the views from the top were gorgeous! After a long hot hike up a mountain, cruise down to sand beach and take the plunge into the crisp cold ocean water to cool down, it’s quite the rush! I will definitely be back to this park.

Absolutely amazing! This beautiful place has millions of tress, along with beautiful wildlife! There are many places to eat nearby, and the town of Bar Harbor is very quaint and inviting! I cannot wait to return

Jordan Pond, Cadillac Mountain and Sand Beach are all MUST-see places when you visit. Get everywhere you really want to go EARLY (like 8:00/8:30am). Parking is a nightmare wherever you go. We did go to a cobblestone beach, which was a hidden treasure. No one was there. The sounds the rocks make when the tide comes in amazing.
review_title: A MUST see for nature lovers

review_body: Very accessible National park. There is many things to do and see here at this park. There is a beach by the ocean, Cadillac Mountain, that when you drive to the top on a clear day, you can see for miles, Thunder Hole that is a must see during high tide and more hiking trails than you can shake a stick at. You can easily spend the whole day here and not experience everything.
Don't be fooled into thinking summer is the only time to visit this national treasure! We are "off seasoners" to the max!!!
review_title: Best National Park this side of the Appalacians! ;)

review_body: Spent 4 days 3 nights in beautiful Acadia. The hiking is amazing, Cadillac mtn is a must. Bar Harbor is a cute touristy New England town. We are headed back in 2018 to do more activities we weren’t able to do last year for lack of time. Bring your bikes and ride the historic carriage roads!! If your thinking of going just pic your top places to see ahead of time and go for it.
review_title: Acadia NP is amazing... you must go!!

review_body: I recommend visiting Acadia National Park in the winter. There are trails, vistas, gorgeous scenery, outdoor activities and winter fun! It is a great place for a family, or just to get away!

Acadia is one of my favorite national parks. Fantastic trails provide beautiful views of the coast. Lots of options of different trails to tackle provide you with plenty of variety. There are many different restaurants outside the park with yummy Maine lobster to enjoy.

Acadia offers to tourists from foreign countries and those from here in the USA interior a chance to see Ireland here in Maine. Beautiful vistas from shore. Rocky crags, pounding surf, lobster boats with real working crews. A chnce to witness whales, camping swimming,Light houses. Acadia has ity all.

I drove through the very scenic park after getting info at the excellent Visitors Center. The drive was very beautiful indeed with places to stop and take in amazing views. Although I did not bring a picnic, there are very nice places for that in the park.

Great views with a lake with mountains and trees in background. Such a great scenic experience. This is one of the most beautiful national parks I have visited. Do not forget to see sunset at the top of Cadillac Mountain.

Was very impressed by the well marked trails, signs along the way and blazes on trees and rocks. Got very helpful advice and suggestions from the visitors center and appreciate that accommodations were made to keep as much of the park open as possible during the off season.

Okey...I know you want to read all about the hidden gems, but golly, there is not one thing I can tell you that others have not already said, except you truly will not regret traveling to Acadia National Park. We went in the fall and was blown away by all the beauty. Yes, there are tour buses, but with a bit of negotiating travel along the loop between the bigger buses (we were in a pickup truck) you are afforded a must see advantage without the press of time. Make sure to bring with you a picnic lunch or prepared to eat at the only restaurant in the park. We brought a "tail gate" fare and was thrilled to find picnic areas. If you are an early riser, you can also take advantage of the park's "first light" on Cadillac Mountain ; the mountain where the sun hits comparatively first in the United States. . Parking fares are available at the park's entrance, but make sure to take advantage of discounts either during regular business hours at the road side center right before getting to the park or go online. We were traveling with a US Marine Veteran and his vehicle was granted free parking permit. Being that we were of "seasoned" years we also got a significant discount by buying our passes prior to getting to the Park's entrance. Still, even if paying full price...you will be afforded a priceless adventure regardless your age.
review_title: Bucket List Check Off.!!! A MUST GO Venue

review_body: Really behind iin writing some reviews as we visited Acadia National Park back in October 2017 but the memories are still just as fresh. Anything I say will only be repeating what others have said about this beautiful park. A most visit if you are ever in Bar Harbor. Just some of the highlights are Cadillac Mountain, Eagle Lake, and Jordan's Pond. Be prepared for some warm and waterproof clothing it visiting in the Fall as it can be chilly with rain. None the less, the wife has said that she would love to go back and spend a week there to see more as we were there as part of a cruise and limited on time.

Looking through pictures of our travels last year reminded me to write a review of this spectacular park. We’ve done three extended visits to the area, and love it more each time we visit. The hiking is spectacular and offers challenges from beginner to expert. The scenery is gorgeous, and the Park Ranger led programs are a lot of fun. Cadillac Mountain at sunrise is something not to be missed. Can’t say enough about this place.
Quite a drive, make sure you have gas (not like me, very close to out of gas). Beautiful views, hike, and scenery, what more do you want!
review_title: Beautiful park to hike and visit

review_body: Amazing views and so many places to explore. This is wonderful (especially during the summer). There are a lot of trails and lots of places to explore. One bonus is there are great micro-breweries within a half hour of the park. Maine is coming into its own.
review_title: Beautiful park in a great state

review_body: We have been to Acadia National Park many times. We enjoy all the National Parks. Here you can experience the ocean, rocky coast, forests, lakes, streams and mountains.
