This park really captures Maine and all its scenic beauty. It's a lot different from the western parks. Mostly because it's small and very dog friendly. But there's great hiking and even the less active can see most of the sights.

Wonderful views. We enjoyed hiking the easier trails. It's pretty even on foggy days. Will have to go back to do more of the trails. Would recommend starting early in the day, before the big bus of people from the cruise comes.
review_title: As gorgeous as everyone said it is

review_body: We have vacationed in this amazing natl park since 1973 and our 2 kids were toddlers thru two granddaughters and now into our retirement! It is ALWAYS a favorite and awesome destination for hiking, biking and touring the magnificent harbors, ocean drives, mountains, lakes and ponds. There are many, many miles of well marked trails that rise to the peaks of glacial mts with amazing views of the Sea dotted by 80 sone islands that dot around the big island. There are miles of great groomed biking trails and a varied guided ranger program that provides wonderful additional experience. This Park is the BEST!!

Our family completed a road trip from Brooklyn, NY to Bar Harbor, ME with stops along the way in Milford CT, Warwick RI, Martha's Vineyard, Boston, MA, and Portland, ME. We loved Acadia National Park. It was definitely the best part of our trip and since it was our last stop of the trip we really wished we could have spent more time here than some of the other stops on the trip, Our only problem we had while there was that as we were driving through we kept turning at the wrong spot. Which added more to the drive to get where we wanted to go since the road is one way and a big loop around the island. This really isn't much of a complaint just know that you need to pay attention or be willing to park and walk around more. I definitely want to come back to explore the area more.

We've been to many National Parks and many have told us that this one is their favorite. We visited in December with below zero temperatures. We will be back to explore more of the park. It was beautiful in winter, I imagine just as beautiful in every season. We took our kids for a walk around Jordan Pond. Beautiful views throughout the trail and park.

Love this park. You can drive for awhile in your car and just stop at different points for walking or pictures. It runs by the ocean and through lakes and ponds. Driving up Cadillac Mountain at sunrise or sunset is easy and recommended.
We were surprised at the beauty of this park in November and was glad to see the crowds were gone . We spent a nice leasurely day with a picnic lunch in the woods .

Stopped here during the winter and only was able to tour the part of the park that was open on the way out of town. Very pretty and worth a visit no matter what time of year. You can hike all year round and no charge to enter the park in the winter.

OMG how beautiful was this National Park????? This was an amazing day spent driving around and stopping to take in the Atlantic Ocean views. So very glad we did this Park. Still talking about it and would go back. The views were amazing.

From the Town Pier you can walk along the way to Village Green. At the centre you can find Island Explorer Free Shuttle Buses which will take you to many destinations in Acadia National Park.It's a wonderful and enjoyable ride. Acadia national Park is the right place for hikers because they can explore and experience the spectacular park. Views are breathtaking and this Park covers nearly half of Mount Desert Island. It attracts more than two million tourists yearly. amongst the park attractions are Cadillac Mountain, the Sand Beach and the Thunder Hole where the surf races into a naturally carved inlet and explodes high into the air with a tremendous roar. This park is peaceful, spectacular and a beautiful experience you'll never forget. No one is to miss this adventure while in Bar Harbor.
If you're in the Bar Harbor area it is an absolute must to visit Acadia! Nothing but breathtaking views and excellent hiking!
even if you go in the late fall early winter, before the snow. this is a beautiful ride around the mountain.

The park is lush with gorgeous foliage! The tour guide did an excellent job of giving us history of the area & of the park’s development. Fascinating details describing the rich heritage of the area. Breathtaking views make this a place I will definitely return to!

New England's only National Park is beautiful and the rocky coast and woodsy trails are spectacular. The one-way Loop Road is good for driving or bicycling. Many natural sites to see but take a short or long hike to experience the beauty of the Maine coast, woods, or mountains. The most popular destinations can be crowded during the summer months so go early in the morning or later in the afternoon to avoid the crowds. Bicycle on the Carriage Roads for a unique experience—my No. 1 recommendation.
review_title: New England's only National Park, it's beautiful

review_body: This was my first time expereincing Acadia. It's VAST, breathtaking, pristine, peaceful, and oh so beautiful. A lovely place to experience.Fall provides an even more spectaclar expereince due to the foliage!

This was the first time visiting Acadia National Park and we were impressed. Much better than I thought it would be and so much to see and do there, no wonder it is one of the most popular parks in the country. We went here in November, so a number of things like restaurants and restrooms were closed. On the other hand, there were less people. If you have a chance to go here, do spend several days exploring the park, you don't want to rush.

A hidden gem, definitely. So many things to do from walking, visiting historic locations, seeing the foliage, and looking for the elusive wildlife. I would heartily recommend ANP to any group or age visitor, literally something for everyone. We enjoyed it in the rain and in the occasional sunshine. Lots of places to stop and things to do.

This was my second trip back to Acadia National Park with the intention of spending more time enjoying the beautiful scenery. I was able to ride my bike and hike many, many miles. The park is exceptional in beauty and accessibility, I would recommend it to all types of nature lovers....young, old, experienced, or new to the outdoors.
review_title: The beauty of Maine at it's finest!

review_body: We visited Acadia National Park in November, which was later than we had planned. The weather is getting cold but the beauty of the park is still obvious. At the beginning is the road to Cadillac Mountain. From Oct to March, this is where the first sunrise is visible in the US. Due to the time of year we went, we did not encounter any traffic jams, but if you go in the summer additional time should be allowed. It is a beautiful site to see the sun rise over the water and islands in the early morning and to say you saw it! If you continue on the road becomes a 27 mile 1-way loop. Our next stop was Sand Beach. This is a smaller sand beach surrounded by the rock cliffs. Rumor has it the water doesn't get much higher than 55 degrees, but nice to check out tidepools and the ocean. We also stopped at Thunder Hole. Unfortunately, the ocean was calm so we weren't able to see the full force. We read the ideal time to see this is 2 hours before high tide and if the water is wavy (after a storm). There is a crevice between rocks where the water comes in and out with the tide. As it comes it it makes at least a gurgling sound, but hopefully a thunderous sound as it hits the cave at the end. There is a walkway down there which when in full force gets pretty wet as the water splashes up like a blowhole. We also visited Bubble Rock ( .5 mile uphill climb ) which gives a beautiful view. There are many trails along the water and cliffs where you can get some fantastic views of the rocks / cliffs.I don't live too far from this park but was my first visit. The scenery was very New England, so not foreign to me. I have also visited 44 National Parks and I can say Acadia is a beautiful park that holds its own against many of the parks out West. A truly New England experience one should not miss!
review_title: A beautiful National Park that rivals the West

review_body: We spent 5 days hiking here. Loved every minute of it. Jordon Pond Trail was our favorite. Felt like we had the whole place to ourselves, being off season and during the week when kids are in school.

My family including teenage kids and their teenage friends all visited the park this weekend for two days. The temps and wind were chilly, but having the place mostly to ourselves to enjoy the beauty around every corner was priceless. Dont miss visiting Sandy beach, or driving up Cadillac mountain.
review_title: One of the most visited national parks, for a reason.

review_body: I have been coming here for 41 years. Now my children come here. Raw, unpolished, beautiful nature in your face. Love this place.
We’ve heard a lot about Acadia National Park, but never had the opportunity to visit until today. Breath taking views. Would highly recommend it to nature lovers!

When my children were young, we came here. And much later we came here on a cruise. But this trip was the best. It is a beautiful park. I am sad that the rates to get in are going up soon because families will have to dig deeper to see this American beauty.

We had a dream of visiting this place during Autumn leaf color season as we are located in Los Angeles. We did it mid October 2017 beginning the drive from Buffalo NY via all the New England States.I have no words to describe the beauty of this National Park in Fall. Entire park was muti-color. We first visited the visitor center and bought entry passes and spend about half day driving and walking through the wonder of the nature. We were staying in Ellsworth about 12 miles to the park as hotels were less expensive there, so we could not stay till late. The park is relatively smaller but a gem.This is a must see at least once.

This was one of the most gorgeous, enjoyable, amazing, trips I have ever taken. We watched the sun rise atop Cadillac Mountain, listened to the booms of Thunder hole, Enjoyed the view from Otter Cliffs, and held giant clams on sandy beach. This place is a truly magical location and if you enjoy natural beauty, you will say, this place was touched by the breath of God. I will be taking my children next time so they can appreciate the beauty of all our nation has to offer.
review_title: Touched by the breath of God

review_body: This was our first trip to Maine, and we thought that Acadia was a must see, but it was way more than just checking off a bucket list item. The place offers many trails to hike, some of which proved too difficult for us, but others that were in our skill range and provided great scenery.

Acadia is great. We went in fall so the crowds were gone and the roads and hiking paths relatively quiet. We did Lots of hikes and there is a good variety of flat and easy or moderate to hard. The beehive was scary but amazing and we continued on to mt Champlain. We saw lots of wildlife like woodpeckers and red squirrels and deer. We also saw multiple active beaver lodges with freshly felled trees and activity. We didnt see the beaver unfortunately. You could stay at acadia for weeks and hike and walk and relax its brilliant.

This has to be a must visit as it comprises about half of Mount Desert Island. A must do by car/bus is the Park Loop Road. There is nothing here to disappoint the traveller looking to see the very best of the wonderful Maine coastline
Beautiful sights! For the early and eager, drive to the top of the Cadillac Mountain for sunrise. Parking lots around Jordan Pond fill up early.

There is so much to see in the Park, we only scratched the surface but its a very beautiful area. Lots of places to walk, lovely beaches and stunning scenery. Would love to return and see some more of it.
Loved everything about Acadia National Park. Go to Cadillac Mountain and see the sunrise breathtaking. Great hikes all over great car ride to see ocean and nature

The photo is that of Jordan Pond, a very tranquil and scenic part of the park. The whole park is absolutely breathtaking. The crowds were manageable due to the time of the year (end of leaf season). One word of caution, the National Park Service charges $25 a car to get in the park. There is a debate going on whether or not to jack this price up to around $70-$75 a car because of "improvements" needed in the park (ya right!). There was opposition to this proposal from many town business owners, and rightfully so!
Beautiful views! And so worth the trip to Bar Harbor! Acadia National Park is all that everyone carries on about!
Such a lovely scenic drive along the park with lots of stops for pictures. Highly recommend this as a destination spot.
Definitely worth at least a day to explore the loop tral. Dont miss thunder cove or sand beach. Bring rain gear. Look for spotted maples.

Great place to sit and relax by the ocean! You can hike a trail from easy to expert! Photograher’s parodise! Jordon Pond, Thunder Hole, Cadillac Mountain, Sand Beach all easily located on the 27 mile loop road!Park Rangers provide guided tours or answer questions at visitor center! You could spend as little as 1/2 a day or explore for multiple days!Cadillac Mountain can get busy at sunrise due to the fact it is the 1st place in the US to see it come up daily!

We visited Acadia National Park and were very impressed by the fall foliage, the scenic drives, and the phenomenal hiking. Cadillac Mountain, the Beehive, Mt Acadia were wonderful hikes. Some of the trails, like the Gorge Path, had amazing construction with granite blocks. There is also great access to activities on the water. The history, the carriage paths and the bridges were like stepping out of time. If Bar Harbour seems too crowded, venture out into the National Park.
review_title: An amazing park with lots to do

review_body: We are Texas Panhandle residents and were looking for some fall color. The park provided us with some beautiful landscapes. We have visited numerous national parks out west and, though beautiful, Acadia is not as impressive as any of the parks in the west and northwest. While we enjoyed our experience, we probably won't be back.

This is a amazing place to visit. There are so many things to see and do. You can drive to see somethings. Climb to see more and do some great hiking to see even more. The carriage trails are great to walk and the so safe even when they are damp.

Really enjoyed my time here. Spent a day doing Cadillac Mountain, Thunder Hole, Bass Harbor Headlight and Bubble Rock. Could have spent a week exploring this park, but enjoyed the limited time we spent here. The foliage was beautiful and the low attendance was a plus. Hoping to make a return trip next year at the same time.
This is one of the finest national Parks and thankfully it is still being well-maintained. The signage, trails, overlooks, roads, carriage roads, campgrounds (though no showers), are all first rate.

We stopped at the visitor center and got a pass for ourselves rather then a tour as we did a tour last year. This is a must do trip, the views along the road at absolutely stunning. There are many carve out spots on the road so you can pull over to admire on your way to the various destinations of the park and you should stop. Of course Cadillac mountain is just breath taking and it's fun to wonder the paths and if your brave enough go off the paths on the rocks. Just be sure to wear appropriate foot wear. We also stopped at Thunder Hole, although this trip no noise and Jordan's pond as well as stops along the way to admire the view. PLEASE if your in the area, go to Bar Harbor. We even went back up to Cadillac mountain on our way home to take in the view one more time. Next time we plan to walk some of the paths and trails to get even more out of the Acadia Experience.

Acadia is a treasure-- be sure to thank the staff and do your part to keep it a wonderful place for the generations to come. Go off season-- avoid the crowdsVisitor center worth a visit and the rangers are very helpful in telling you about different places depending on your abilities, time and weather.We spent five days and could have spent another weekDo the beach loop but walk back from thunder hole where the crowds gather-- many nice places just north that you can walk to and get down to the rocks overlooking the water's edge.Were there during a storm with gale force winds-- surf was spectacular. We went to sand beach-- almost empty at this time of year and scrambled up the headland's loop-- need to be a bit more adventuresome.-- there are scrambles up the granite. Strongly recommend you take some walks on the carriage trails. They were empty and it was nice not worrying about cars.The Jordan Pond trail is a 3.2 mile loop around the lake. A bit of scramble on some rocks for about 0.1 miles -- don't get discouraged.

The day we visited the park was during heavy rain, but the beautiful change in leaf colors still came through. Saw gushing waterfalls and many beautiful views. Stopped at Cadillac Mtn (gushing waterfalls but too cloudy on top of the mountain), Jordan Pond House (restaurant closed, scenic view was being excavated), Seal Harbor (ok), Sand Beach (cool breakers & Old Soaker), Thunder Hole (the park highlight showing the power of the sea), and Otter Cliff (huge spraying breakers). We had to leave the next day which had sunny weather, but our friends liked the park so much that they returned the next day - a two-hour trip one way from where we were staying!

Acadia National Park is yet another of our beautiful U.S. national parks. You can take the loop road and drive around the park, you can do some hiking, take advantage of the beautiful carriage roads, and more. Be aware that, if you're interested in going to the Hulls Cove Visitor Center, you have to climb 52 steps to get there. If you have mobility issues, you may want to skip that and move on to other parts of the park that are more viable for those with mobility challenges.
review_title: Lots of variety in the park

review_body: We had two beautiful days to explore Acadia National Park. Not enough time to enjoy everything. Watched the sun raise on Cadillac Mt. Beautiful. We will be back to spend more time.
The fall colors were outstanding. The park is remarkable. I wish we had more time to do some hiking. We drove around the loop road and took in Mother Nature at her best.

The park is awesome and many things to see BUT you MUST get up early and go up Cadillac Mountain and watch the sun rise. You will not be disappointed. Being among the first on the east coast to see the sun rise, above the clouds, was heavenly. Make it a priority.
user_location: North Salem, New York, United States

review_body: What can I say? Beautiful park, lovely scenery, autumn foliage, pretty drive, cool crisp air, slim crowds, hiking trails, sandy beach, wildlife, nature at its best! So glad that we visited during offseason...I can't imagine the traffic jams during summer, especially with the tour buses. We spent 2 full days but could have easily spent a week exploring the park! Mom was able to use her senior park pass for the first time, so that was a nice savings! :) I recommend getting your passes, maps, and things to see/do before arriving. One of the most stunning national parks I've been to! Make a trip!

What an amazing place this is! You can visit it with children or elderly. Pets welcome on leads. So many options! You can make the hikes/walks as easy or as difficult as you want. The nature is just stunning with all the autumn colours at the moment - obviously that all changes. Highly recommend to visit this place!
Such a beautiful place!! So many areas to stop to enjoy the view and take pictures! and the trip up to Cadillac mountain is totally beautiful!!!

Acadia is like no other national park especially in the fall. The rugged coastline is really something to behold. The weather while we were there was cloudless and sunny. You have to go at least there at least once in your life.

Acadia gets day trippers off the cruiseships ( 3000-10000 cruisers per day in Bar Harbor) and many tourists from Bar Harbor seeking the special views on the mountain tops . It is a two lane road to accomodate seasonal travelers not so well. Backups occur and the driver hates to stop to take a view to lose their place in line up the hill. This is not an easy visit in season Choose to go before or after the cruise ships! Never in the middle of the day
review_title: Acadi needs to be enjoyed with few cars and lots of sunshine.

review_body: Hiking trails, views from Cadillac Mountain, biking on carriage trails--a treasure of a park. Could spend weeks exploring without retracing a step.
review_title: October time for peak fall foliage

review_body: All of our National Parks are wonderful....Acadia is no exception. Perhaps one difference here (versus many other National Parks) is that the roads are pretty much a circle (technically closer to an oval) around the park. Thus, to us, the park was very easy to navigate. There is a restaurant, Jordan Pond, available for food....if you are on a tight schedule, you might consider packing your lunch.We visited late in September. We did not have any problem parking at any of the sites/lookouts. Like most National Parks we have visited, parking may have been a problem during the peak of the tourist season. It was interesting that there were a number of areas where parking was permitted on the main road to supplement parking lots or turn-offs. The reason that this was possible is that the roads were one way roads at those points.Lots to see and appreciate.....take plenty of pictures.

Loved this place. This is one of our favorite parks. There are so many different kinds of trails. There are ocean trails, lake trails, mountain trails, island trails. We loved the variety and the scenery.

We only had one day to see the park, started at Hulls Cove visitor center. We watched the short film and bought a CD that gave directions and information about the park. We found it was very helpful and well worth the price. We did the park loop road, made many stops to see the scenery and take pictures. The views were breathtaking, still a lot of fall colors which were beautiful. We did a couple of short walks/hikes, there are trails for all skill levels and they are clearly marked. We drove to the top of Cadillac Mountain, again spectacular views. That was all we were able to do in one day but still felt it was worth it, we can't wait to come back and see more.

We spent about five hours in the park one day and several the next. There were lots of tourists, more than I thought there'd be in October. We visited Sand Beach and Great Head. Once we got away from tourists and off the beaten path we loved the area and experience. Leaves were changing so there was a variety of color. The beach area and rocky areas to the north were wonderful to walk and hike on. Cadillac Mountain has wonderful panoramic views. We were told to go there at sunrise and thought we'd be part of a small group. There were at least 1,000 people there, many before 6 a.m. If you're going to do the sunrise (and you should), go early!! When we got there at 6:20 a.m. the parking lot was completely full and cars were parked down the road on both sides. This is not normally allowed but I think park rangers don't worry about it because the crowd dissipates once people have seen the sunrise. It's spectacular!
review_title: Lots of People, Even in October!

review_body: A circular coastal tour which is worthy of its name.Plenty of stopping off points and places to admire the scenery.We used a cd to guide us around and that was really useful. Even though it was late October it was busy - last week of the seasonWell worth the trip and the fall colours were glorious

Did a 2 nights at Acadia National Park to catch the fall colours.Although we managed to catch the colours, I believe there will be more coloured foliage come end Oc/early Nov.Though you may be spoilt for choice, for lodging, as there are many inns, motels and guest houses in Acadia but may be full due to the high traffic of leaves peepers (people coming to catch the fall foliage).Though there are restaurants in the town centre of Bay Harbour but there's only those few restaurants and waiting time may stretch from 25minutes (non-peak) to 75minutes (peak hours) due to high fall traffic.We have been told that it is a must to try the lobsters when in Maine. We had the boiled lobsters, in order to try its original taste, as well as the infamous lobster roll, in one of the popular seafood restaurant by the pier. Honestly, I personally prefer the ones at Luke's, at half the price!If you are seeking adventure, you may go trekking on one of the many trails, kayaking or even a swim at one of the beaches(if the weather permits).Catching sunrise and sunsets were definitely worth our while as you see the sun rays stream through the foliage, as if you are driving through a sea of gold and fire.Of course, the best way to catch the foliage is by car.Definitely a must if you are in the area at the time of the year!
The Acadia National Park is a National treasure. It offers wonderful opportunities for walking, hiking and touring by car or by Trolley. It was the highlight of our trip to Maine
review_title: This Park sets the Island above all those in the area

review_body: Absolutely LOVED this park. The views were amazing from everywhere. Jordan's Pond is must. The hike around the pond is beautiful and the views will take your breath away.

Was a crowded weekend and a tour ship was in town but still not to be missedWe saw Cadillac mountain and the lake near the restaurant.Was worth fighting the crowds.Lots of bikers and walkers Wear tennis shoes, bring hat and sunscreen

Visiting here as cruise stop excursion. Beautiful area, but most crowded weekend for touring, unknowingly. Have been here 2 or 3 times in past years for longer visit. Bus tour of the loop brought me up to date, but bit of a disappointment as October crowds meant the loop road to Cadillac Mountain summit had periods of closure. However, achieved goal of seeing it in Fall. Prior times were summer visits. Such a wonderful place one ought to take a week to thoroughly see and do everything. Would have appreciated extra time to kayak Frenchman's Bay.
review_title: Typical day tour isn't enough to absorb all the beauty and grandeur that is Acadia.

review_body: What an amazing park!!! So much to do!!! Even just driving the park loop is great! So many great trails and amazing views. Definitely a place to go in your lifetime!!!! I am already planning my return visit!!!

This national park has so much to offer. We spent three days in the park for various lengths of time. We enjoyed the sunrise on Cadillac Mountain as well as many hikes and of course the drive around the loop. There is so much to see and do. We were fortunate to be there during almost peak leaf season. So much beauty!
Awesome spot for wandering and walking. Views change around every curve and a fantastic. Not overpowering like Yosemite or the Grand Canyon. Still mighty fine.
review_title: Awesome spot for wandering and walking

review_body: Cadillac Mountain is well worth driving up to see. Amazing 360 views. Sunset is also very beautiful but very crowded.

Plan to spend at least 3 days to explore the wonderful opportunities for photography, hiking, and exploring the park. Be prepared to deal with bus tour crowds at Jordan Pond. It is best to visit Jordan Pond in the early morning, certainly before 10 am. A visit to Bass Harbor Light is best planned for morning or late evening just before sundown. There are many opportunities for easy walks several challenging hiking trails.

Visited here as part of a cruise stop, so had a somewhat limited time frame. We chose to take a bus tour by Ollie’s Trolley (See Separate Review). The park itself is beautiful, with lots to see. There are many interesting hiking trails and places to stop throughout the park. We visited Thunder Hole, Jordan Pond and went to the top of Cadillac Mountain, and all were very-well maintained and interesting to see. If doing the park on your own, a stop at the Visitor Center would be very beneficial. There’s lots of history and interesting tidbits to learn from either park rangers or printed brochures that would definitely enhance your visit. Highly recommended!
review_title: Lots to See at Beautiful National Park

review_body: My husband used to be a backpacker before illness confined him to an electric scooter and this was a great place for him to be able to enjoy the woods while giving me a hike. The trail from the parking lot at the north side of Eagle Lake along the side of Eagle Lake up to Bubble Pond is totally flat and accessible. We also walked the other direction up to Witch Hole Pond - also accessible, but don't go beyond marker 2 - we were warned that the trail rises steeply from that point.
review_title: Carriage roads along Eagle Lake great for handicapped access

review_body: This national park offers stunning views, great hiking, and carriage trails that are perfect for biking. You can certainly spend several days taking in the scenic beauty at Acadia. Will definitely return soon.
We took the 26 mile loop drive within the park and stopped many times to take pictures and admire the vistas. Beautiful fall colors......

Great scenery. Traffic on the roads within the park light but many overviews had no parking spaces so some stops we wanted to view at we could not. Within the park, the wait for lunch over an hour, drove to Bar Harbor for lunch, no parking, left and found a general store a couple miles outside of town and had a hot dog. Another recommendation. With so many people in the park, better make reservations for any of the activities well in advance. We had none for a carriage ride, no dice. Booked full at least a day in advance and maybe longer. A man in line told me he had called at 8 AM that morning and got a reservation only because there was a cancellation called in. This is in the Fall mind you, so summer I'm told is much worse.  And don't forget to bring a picnic lunch along with you.
One of our favorite places - beautiful North Atlantic blue ocean, humpy mountains, rocky granite cliffs, lots of trails. Especially beautiful in the autumn with stunning peak colors!

The day we drove up Cadillac Mountain, there was so much fog that we didn't see much going up or at the top. However, it burned off and the views coming down were breathtaking. We went to Thunder Hole, but the tide was going out. It was still a beautiful place. It is an absolute a must to go up the mountain!
We visited this attraction on a sunny and warm September day, the sea was sparkling and the sky bright blue. The cost was reasonable and there were many spectacular views.
Take the loop, then see sunrise at Cadilac Mt. The carraige trails looked amazing, just did not have time to bike.

Driving the Loop Road within Acadia National Park is a feast for the eyes. There is great scenery the entire way and the 360 degree view from the top of Cadillac Mountain is breathtaking! Don't miss this!
review_title: Must see when in Bar Harbor

review_body: The park is huge and once at the top you get incredible views of the entire area. Plus if you are into hiking they have tons of trails.

My wife and I talked for many years about a trip to coastal Maine during the Fall, specifically visiting Acadia National Park. We finally made the trip this past week and, despite lofty expectations, it did not disappoint.Acadia is the second-most visited national park, after Yellowstone. Don't let this scare you away. Thousands of these visitors come from massive cruise ships that regularly visit Bar Harbor. These visitors come on buses and do not populate the hiking trails.Some of our highlights include:* Lunch at the Jordan House restaurant. The food was surprisingly good, especially the customary popovers.* The hike around Jordan Pond is a relatively easy 3.5-mile walk. We started on the left side which begins with a long (about a mile, or more) of planks that you walk on followed by some easy rock climbing. Then, it's an easy walk the rest of the way. The scenery is gorgeous.* Hiking the Bee Hive, including using the metal rungs embedded in the sheer cliffs. It sounds a little scary - and looks scary from below - but it's not all that challenging BUT it is very rewarding. Plus the views are incredible.As you might suspect, get an early start to avoid the cruise ship crowds and bring a change of clothes for changing conditions. It quickly can change 20-30 degrees and rain can begin at the drop of a hat.In short, we LOVED Acadia and recommend it highly. It is worth the visit.

We were on our way to Bar Harbor... 2nd visit...... Had to go to Acadia National Park too. I am a native of Southern California & was just in Yosemite the end of September. Just HAD TO stop @ this Eastern Coast National Park too!!!! Our National Park System in the USA are WONDERFUL!! Buy a discounted year pass--- Senior price offered.

The pictures truly don't do it justice. Jordan pond, eagle lake, Cadillac mountain- all spectacular! Do some hiking for some great views- if you want to see the sun rise at Cadillac mountain- arrive at least 45 minutes before sunrise for parking.

We cannot say enough about how much natural beauty there is in the park! We arrived early - advised - and were stopped and taking pictures by 8:50 am. I hear the sunrise is something to be seen, but we didn't know that at the time. Breathtaking views about around every turn. We saw as much of the park as we could in 4 hours. (not nearly enough!) We will return. We happened to be there on National Public Lands Day, so the admission was free. This was the highlight of my husband's Maine vacation!! We drove to the top of Cadillac Mountain, enjoyed the gift shop, had our picture taken, and just basked in the beauty all around. There was also a stopping place at Jordan Pond House with another great gift shop, views, and information on the history of Maine. Planned on an hour, stayed four, didn't scratch the surface. Plan on a day here. Bring your lunch. Five Stars all the way around.

National Park. What's not to like! ...except when it's foggy. Make sure to grab your passes. Check out the length of the Carriage road you plan to hike. We thought it was 2 Miles. It was really 6. I still have the blisters on my feet. I'd go back tomorrow.
We rode bikes through the park and had an extremely enjoyable day experiencing the amazing colours the trees displayed in Autumn. It was a spectacular sight and I recommend the visit to anybody.
We really enjoyed this park. We took a bus tour to familiarize ourselves with the history and geography of the park. The autumn leaves are late turning color this year but the park was beautiful.

This year will mark my seventh time visiting Arcadia. And each time it's been a wonderful experience. The restaurants, the hiking, and the overall ambiance are just tailor-made for a relaxing vacation!

Due to Hurricane Irma trip was a bit delayed so did not get as much time here as originally planned. The path along the ocean inside the park is breathtaking in both fog and sun -not to be missed - if it is misty ,rainy or foggy be aware the granite rocks can be very slippery. The carriage trails are so well maintained and offer HOURS of walking in peace. I could return every year! The bus system makes it so easy to get to park .
review_title: So good we want to return!! BEAUTIFUL place

review_body: I would recommend that you shell out $13 at the visitor's center and get the CD that is essentially an audio tour of the park. It helps tell the story and points out what you are seeing at most of the pull off places. Overall the views are impressive, especially Cadillace Mountain where you see green trees and blue water on almost all sides.
Beautiful park, I would definitely recommend getting up early and watching the sunrise on top of Cadallic Mountain!

Cadallic Mountain is the main attraction with a good view of Bar Harbor, lots of busses and people when we were there in mid-September. The loop road in a nice drive and you can visit other harbors besides Bar Harbor during the drive. We were a bit early for the leaf colors but still several harbor scenes to see and photograph.

We drove to Cadillac Mountain from Boston on Oct 11, arriving near sunset. It was cold and windy and we didn't spend much time atop the mountain. On Oct 12, we wanted to take a hike and selected the Bald Mountain Summit hike. It is about an 800' ascent but I would say it is somewhat rugged. My wife and I are in our early 60s, in pretty good shape, and found the many rocky areas to be rather challenging. However, the fall foliage was developing (one of the reasons we went to Maine) and the day was cloudless which made for wonderful views as we climbed. We finishing the day back at Cadillac Mountain BEFORE sunset. We walked the summit path (about .5 miles) and had terrific 360 degree views. On Oct 13, we had only a few hours and decided to hike the Jordan Pond Loop, a 3.4 mile trail around Jordan Pond. There was quite a bit of color on the surrounding hills and the water in Jordan Pond is gin-clear. We loved this trail and would recommend it.

We spent the day leisurely driving through the park and it did not disappoint! There are many pulloffs with wonderful views of forests, lakes, and the coast. The carriage roads are a great hike, also. Being in mid October, we were hoping for more foliage color, but were still pleased with what we saw. I would love to return one day for more hiking!

Any visit to Bar Harbor is missing a key element if you don't tour the park. The top of Cadillac Mountain is easily accessible and affords great views, even if there are many people, because it is so spread out. Try the walk around the right side of Jordan's Pond near dusk to avoid crowds and for an easy, relaxing walk. However, the popovers at Jordan's Pond Restaurant are overrated.

Thunder hole was my favorite stop on the park loop. What an amazing experience to see this natural wonder. We also drove to the top of Cadillac Mountain in late September and the parking area was very full. We tried a couple of times to get to Jordan Pond but were not able to find a place to park. We planned to get up the next day to go and watch the sunrise, but it was foggy so we didn't make the trip. This is a wonderful park and is a must see if you're in Bar Harbor.

Cadillac Mountain is the ideal place to see the sunrise, at more than 1500 feet high, one can see the sun rays hits United States first. We arrived at the peak at about 0515 hour, and there were already flocks of spectators. We finally sat and watch the orange red light which was spectacular. It was really worthwhile getting up in the morning to watch it. But get there early to get a parking spot.
review_title: Fantastic Sunrise at the Cadillac Mountain

review_body: This was the third time to visit and the traffic was not nearly as bad before as it was this time. People everywhere. It is worth it though. Must go to the top of Cadillac Mountain. You can see for miles.
Acadia is magical. The views are amazing and not to be missed. Though parking was tight, as the season was ending we were lucky. Don't rush the views -

We spent 2 days in Bar Harbor and visited Acadia NP both days. The first day was devoted fully to the park. We drove the loop and hiked around, spending about 7 hours in the park in total. The Great Head Trail was a treat, with amazing views form the end of the peninsula. Great tidal pools as well, and a fair amount of privacy. Jordan Pond itself was lovely, but we just couldn't imagine spending an hour waiting for a table at the lodge itself. Cadillac Mountain is obviously a must, but I'd recommend trying to find the actual marked peak (the geo market in the rock). Not only will you be at the tippy-top, but you'll be able to look over at all the tourists over on the path. We went way off-peak, in October. I highly recommend that time of year if you can swing it. Crisp autumn air and the changing leaves. And since enjoyment of the park is dependent upon travelling a single one-way (mostly) loop road, your enjoyment is highly subject to those around you. I can't imagine the traffic jams there must be in summer. Go off-peak and enjoy the park without the crowds.
We toured Acadia NP to Cadillac mountain. We loved it! The park is beautiful! It was a beautiful day, as well!

We wanted to see Acadia in fall and our visit did not disappoint. The fall leaves were spectacular and gives a totally different perspective to the park. I have visited a multitude of National Parks across the US and I would have to say this is in my top 10. So many beautiful vistas and a variety of things to do with your time.
Very beautiful fall foliage hike over Mt Dorr and Mt Cadillac. Many pictures taken. Only a few other hikers.

We have been to a few national parks, but Acadia is now our favorite. We traveled from FL to visit and were so impressed. First of all the Island Explorer bus service is absolutely amazing. You can get anywhere within the park on the bus. The Park Loop Road is just beautiful. We had a CD from our B&B which had a couple dozen stops along the way and explained so much about the building of the park, roads, etc. I highly recommend getting the CD. Took us two days to finish as we stopped and hiked and took pictures and relaxed. We were in Bar Harbor for six days and visited the park almost each day. One day we rented bikes in town and took them on the Island Explorer into the park. The carriage roads are amazing for walking and biking. Everything seemed to be well marked. At one point we even hopped on the bus with our bikes to get to another location instead of back-tracking on the bikes. Rangers were extremely helpful. And the views are spectacular. We don't like to go to the same place twice, but we may make an exception for Acadia.
A visit to Bar Harbour must include a trip around the park , fantastic ocean road and do not leave out going up the mountain well worth the drive up to the top.

Acadia National Park has a great park driving loop that takes you around to all the sights. Our particular stops included Cadillac mountain (which I'd assume is a stop for just about everyone), the sand beach, Gorham mountain trail, Bubble Rock trail, Jordan Pond trail (and gift shop) and a few other miscellaneous stops. My wife has balance issues so our hike around Jordan Pond was a real adventure with the long (and slow for us) walk over its wooden planks. The planks then ended at a section where you needed to hike over and around a section of large rocks. But balance issues aside, it was fun! We spent two full days in the park which was sufficient for us to see many of the main attractions. I wholeheartedly recommend visiting Acadia National Park and Bar Harbor, Maine.
review_title: Great national park with convenient park loop

review_body: Although the circular route is only 27 miles long it took us 7 hours to complete the tour. Starting with an introductory video in the Visitors Centre to set the seen you are then tempted to stop at every opportunity to enjoy the vista or walk through the gardens etc.Try to time your visit to be at the top of Cadillac Mountain to enjoy the sunset. Parking can be a little difficult but a space opens up after a short period. Worth the wait.
review_title: Brilliant way to spend a sunny day and watch the sunset.

review_body: Awesome, but weather dependent-fog is constant most days on Cadillac, but when it's clear..OH WOW! This is one of the most visited parks & it's starting to show. The first day we visited parking was impossible. Is it time to limit private vehicles? (before you come for me with the flaming torches, see Zion NP) If I'm back in the area I would certainly consider the free shuttle-I think it would save some frustration! But GO-it's beautiful!
review_title: Amazing natural beauty, but are we loving it too much?

review_body: Acadia National Park is a great way to spend a day. The views are outstanding! Lots of places to pull over and see the beauty of Maine!
must do the loop drive, shell beach and try some of the trails. some are tamer than others, maps provided everywhere.

This park is absolutely beautiful! There are many carriage trails that you can ride your bike through or hike. There is also a restaurant that has delicious food at Jordan Pond. We enjoyed the beautiful scenery and biking in this park. Great place to be!
Our October bike ride was fantastic. 20 miles on carriage roads with no street crossings or cars. Fall foliage was just starting to come out the 9th of October.
There is so much diversity - from Cadillac Mountain to Thunder Hole - this is a must visit park. There is a free bus from Bar Harbor, but there are tours, as well as driving on your own.

The National Park Service has done an amazing job in enabling lots of people to be able to see Acadia National Park, but also keeping it very natural. The hiking trails are beautifully maintained, and built using naturally available materials.

This was our second visit to the park. First time for a tour as part of a cruise. This time we had all day and it was great, walking at our own pace, thunder hole, walking on the beach and climbing to the summit of Cadillac Mountain. Environment is outstanding! Would definitely recommend.

This national park is our favorite spot on the east coast. Can get busy in summer so plan ahead, but whatever you do you have to visit this park. As gorgeous as the day is long, I rank it up with Alaska for scenic beauty

Miles and miles of beautiful hiking trails, many with wonderful views to die for, made our visit fantastic. It takes only a few minutes on a trail to escape the crowds and find your own special experience. Carriage paths only add to the options and yes, the Atlantic Ocean is only a few steps away.
We like visiting National Parks and have been from the Everglades to Glacier to Yosemite to Saguaro. This park should be on your list of places to see. The scenery is spectacular.
review_title: Put this on your bucket list!

review_body: Driving through Acadia National Park was amazing. The views were like none I had seen before as this was our first time visiting Maine. Highly recommend driving through and stopping for amazing sights
Hiking the trails of Acadia National Park is a wonderful and beautiful experience. Most of the hiking is not very strenuous, but the views are super.

This park is huge with so many things to do. Visitor center has a short introductory movie. Park Loop Road is a 27 Mile drive around that has scenic vistas, Beach area, forests, water views and mountains. For more athletic folks there is hiking on carriage roads (no cars) as well as biking and horse back riding. Campgrounds dot the park. Also walking trails are available along some of the coast line.
This is one of the most beautiful places I/we have ever seen. From the Coastal Trail to Cadillac Mountain to the Lighthouses it is breathtaking. Can't wait to go back

We drove to Acadia by car but if you prefer you can use busses which are free starting from Bar Harbor going along Park Loop Road and stopping at all the park attractions. We loved Sand Beach which has blue waters, yellow sand and the most spectacular location as well as Cadillac Mountain and the lighthouse in Bass Harbor. The views in the park are fantastic, the places of interest available by car, bike or foot. The hiking trails are prepared to perfection as well. This Park is great for people of all ages although parents of toddlers in strollers may find it difficult to move around likewise elderly persons who have problems walking. There are clear signs and descriptions everywhere so you shouldn't get lost. A must to see for nature lovers.
review_title: An excellent, beautiful and amazing place

review_body: This was our first time at Acadia National Forest. We bought the car pass, watched the introductory film and were on our way on the road to the highest mountain. We stopped at almost every parking area to take in the sights, and take photos. It is truly a lovely place!
Amazing views. Can't pick a favorite. From sunrise to sunset, every part of the park is absolutely beautiful
Once we figured out the layout of the roads and the free bus service, we had a blast! Great views of the rocky coast and a huge variety of hiking trails. Great food most everywhere
Worth the price of admission by a long shot. Don't miss Cadillac Mountain and get there at sunrise if you can.

Ended up there on a sat., sun., was way to crowded. It is a wonderful view, did the 20 mile loop. Went to the top of Cadillac Mtn. and finally found a space to park on sat, returned on sun. and could not find any place to park. There is limited pull offs and in some areas, which are one way only, you can park in the right hand lane, which was also iffy to find a place to park if you have difficulty walking. I advise you to stop if you see a spot, because remember it is one way in certain areas so you can not turn around, you would need to re do part of the loop. Also, I stopped to get driving permit at one of the visitors centers which was like 54 steps to the top office, then learned that if you go out of the parking lot and turn right , there is a road that takes you to the top for handicapped access. There are different passes , for my car it was $25.00 for a week pass, For myself, I still prefer the Blue Ridge parkway, especially in the Smokey Mountains.
The views in Acadia National Park were wonderful. The monastery and the small garden were wonderful to view.

We took a four hour tour of Acadia with a tour guide who was wonderfully knowledgeable. We wound in and out of national park property and skirted properties of well-known, vastly rich for (so we could ALMOST see how the other folk live).(Matha Stewart has a home nearby and John D Rockefeller had a home here before his death and he contributed generously to the park)
We loved Acadia. Cadillac mountain's view is incredible. Sands Beach is very relaxing. We will be back.

Beautifully maintained. Fantastic walking trails. Easy to drive in and see the sights. Amazing popovers at Jordon Pond and the mixture can be perchased for home preparation. A beautiful park not to be missed.

This is a gem of a national park. The trails are very well maintained thanks to the countless of volunteers who work hard to maintain them along with the oark staff. The carriage road system is a delighted for runnners, bike riders or anyone who perfers to walk on level surfaces.

We spent 4 days in the park and were never disappointed. The views are spectacular, if you want to be active there is so much to do - hike, bike, kayak. Just a beautiful place and we will be back year after year.
review_title: You must see all that Acadia National Park has to offer!

review_body: Do not miss if you are in the Bar Harbor area! So scenic and easy to navigate! Cadillac Mt is not to be missed!! Views are breathtaking!! Be sure to stop by Thunder Hole and Jordan's Pond!
Acadia has so much to offer. It's a must-see for anyone who loves nature! We wish we could live in Acadia!

The park is so beautiful. Could not get enough of the views. Trails, scenes, beach, lakes shopping . i can not say enough about this park. So beautiful. Hiked in and around the park. We lunched at the restaurant near Jordan Pond. Eating the wonderful popovers and blueberry ice tea. Drove to the top of Cadillac mountain. Such a pretty day. Passing many hikers and bikers.

We very much enjoyed a ride through the park. Views were spectacular. The roads are well marked and easy to navigate. Stops at Cadillac mountain was a must do. Jordan pond is a scenic spot among many. Stop for popovers at Jordan Pond restaurant.

We lived in New Jersey 20 years ago and never went to Acadia. This time around we decided to take a week off to explore Maine and Acadia was the anchor of our visit. You can kyak, swim, bike, walk, run, treck, hike, drive, watch birds, go on ferries to the islands, kiss the first rays of Sun gracing America at Cadillac, watch the spectacular sunset off the Cadillac overlooking blue hills, take a break in Jordon Pond House, drive to Bar Harbour for amazing food, entertainment and drinks...the todo in Acadia is almost endless. Three full days were not enough for us.! I have written seperate, iindividual reviews of the key attractions such as Cadillac, Jordan lake, Bass Harbour etc. Experiencing Acadia is among the best gifts you can give to yourself and the loved ones.
review_title: The best of nature in East of US !

review_body: Reading didn't prepare me for the beauty of this place. Minimum of two days here, do tour (s) the first day and your own vehicle the second. You could spend weeks here and not see it all. I could spend an entire day on top of Cadillac Mountain. Drive the loop road and stop every chance you get.

We spent 3 days in and around the Park... Cadillac Mountain, thunder hole, sand beach... If you can you MUST see the sunrise from Cadillac but you got to get up there by a hour before sunrise just to get a parking spot but well worth it... ALSO DRESS WARM!!!!! including gloves and hat if late September on
review_title: Acadia The Gem of the North East

review_body: Acadia is so worth a visit. There are so many ways to see the park no matter what your fitness level. It is truly a gem and we are so grateful to have had the opportunity to bike and hike in this amazing national park.
review_title: Highlight of visit to Bar Harbor

review_body: This is a lovely national park. It is also very popular. With that comes lots and lots of people. We were there on a Saturday in September and traffic was backed up until we got beyond any of the big attractions - Cadillac Mountain - Thunder Hole - Sand Beach. Sand Beach was nuts and there was nowhere to park anywhere near. So I think we learned that you don't go on a weekend, but it is very much worth the trip.

AMAZING! 5 days and not enough to see it all. Highly recommend the Ocean Trail, Jordan's Pond, The Beehive, Precipice Trail. Hiking to the top of Cadillac mountain provided awesome views. If you love hiking and climbing on granite rocks to see 360 views then, this is the perfect place to do it!
review_title: Why You Go to Bar Harbor

review_body: My wife and I spent two days visiting the Park. The first day we took the free bus trip along the Loop Road, however, we had fog on the first half of the Loop and missed some outstanding natural vistas along the Main Coast. We did stop at Jordan Pond and ordered their signature popovers. The view from Jordan Pond should not be missed. The Loop Road bus trip and the lunch stop at Jordan Pond took up most of the morning and early afternoon. The next day, We decided to drive the section of the Loop Road we missed and the vistas were awe inspiring. We also drove the entire Mount Desert Island Loop which was not to be missed either. We saw the villages of Northeast Harbor, Southwest Harbor and Bass Harbor(where we had lobster rolls at the Seafood Ketch Restaurant). A truly great and unstressful vacation.

Spent a full day at Acadia. Amazing sites and views. Top notch rangers to guide you and provide information. Hiking and walking trails were well laid out and beautiful as were all the scenic views. Followed the loop trail with an informative CD. Cadillac mountain and the surrounding views were marvelous.

The park is absolutely beautiful with stunning views and activities for everyone. We hiked, drove to Cadillac Mountain along the Park Loop Road and took one of the Carriage Rides. It was a wonderful trip.
Amazing views and hikes at Cadillac Mountain and great food at Jordan Pond Restaurant. We have never been here before, and were fortunate enough to have stunning weather. Highly recommended
review_title: Cadillac Mountain and Jordan Pond Restaurant

review_body: Beautiful views of the ocean, gorgeous beach and great hiking. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this National Park. We have been to many of the National Parks and this is one of the best.

Something for everybody! Great hiking, a sand beach, and a free island shuttle to help you get around. If you are going to do any of the back country hikes, buy a trail map at the visitors center. Trails are well marked with cairns and blue paint marks, however, finding the trails and planning the trip is much easier with the trail map.

All the national parks are the pride of America but each is different from the other. Acadia doesn't have ten thousand foot mountains or deep canyons but it is beautiful in its own way. The coast line is something you won't forget. I could have spent all day just watching the waves crashing on the rocks. The views from Cadillac Mountain can't be beat. On a clear day you can see forever. The hiking trails and carriage roads are out of this world. We took a horse drawn carriage ride from the stables and I highly recommend it. It's a great way to see the carriage roads if you don't want to hike or bike around. The lakes and ponds offer loads of great photo ops. Another great thing about Acadia is that it's a short distance from Bar Harbor which in itself is pretty great. Enjoy!

Acadia is my happy place. Enjoy a day hiking, biking, attending a ranger program, tea and popovers at Jordan Pond or take a book and sit on the rocks near Otter Cliffs and just enjoy the sun and sea air. There is so much to do and see in this magnificent park and yet you can also just sit quietly and take in the beauty.

Acadia is by far my favorite National Park. The green lush forest and waterways are extraordinary. The excellent roads through the park make exploration so easy with access to many hiking trails and carriage roads.

I spent the last week on vacation in Acadia National Park with my wife and we had a great visit. Parts of the park were pretty crowded, but it was all manageable. The visit was really worth it. We did several guided activities with local guides and that made the trip even better.
review_title: Acadia National Park is a great Vacation spot.

review_body: What can I say - it's a beautiful national park on with the best of the mountains and the ocean at your beck and call! At the Hulls Cove visitor center we purchased the Acadia National Park audio tour for $13. If not on the trolly, I felt the CD was well worth the purchase. We visited in late September and this park is open 24 hours - check hours. When we drove through from 10 am - 1 pm it was so crowded with people, automobiles and tour buses, so we returned again at dusk for a second go round and it was spectacular! The crowd level, the lighting for photos and the scenery.
review_title: Visit Acadia - visit, it's why you came

review_body: This is a fairly old national park with a lot of coastal beauty. It can be easily accessed by numerous roads and easy to moderate trails. Take a boat tour to better appreciate the beauty.
A must see. Super views and great biking as well as hiking trails. Very close to Bar Harbor too. One of the nicest parks I have visited in the states.
We get a sack lunch and sit on the rocks enjoying the view . DO NOT miss Acadia National Park . a must visit .

Loved Acadia National Park!! We parked at the visitor's center and walked a couple miles on the walkway over looking the coast. Many, many places to stop and enjoy the beautiful views and surrounding scenery. Driving up Cadillac Mountain to the summit and viewing the scenery below is a must!! Be sure to allow all or most of the day for the Loop Road trip in the park.

Acadia was everything I thought if would be and then some, The hiking was wonderful. The 27 mile scenic drive was incredible. The beauty of this park is so magnificent and breathtaking!. I am planning on going back again in the near future. This should be on everyone's bucket list.!

The park is full of beautiful sights just made for picture taking. The park loop road has many pull off where you can take pictures or visit the sights like the sand beach, bubble beach, thunder rocks, etc. I think the price was $25/car but I used my senior pass and got in free. Definitely a place to must see.

Definitely do this in a car or motorcycle. We also saw bikers but it is rather steep at times. Beautifully maintained park road. One way most of the way. Definitely stop at all of the vistas, Thunder Hole, Jordan Pond and if you can, reserve a Horse led Carriage Ride (you need to do this well in advance or call the day of to see if there were cancellations). Cadillac Peak has awesome views and nice walking paths.

This national park is beautiful and peaceful with green hills and mountains and ocean vistas that are just inspiring. We very enjoyed touring the park on our own as well as learning all about its history from a trolley tour. Hiking, biking, carriage rides, free park explorer bus transportation (sponsored by LLBean) allow you to linger longer and enjoy all that the park offers.

We arrived right before Fall Colors, some trees were starting to turn. The best thing about this visit was the HUGE waves caused by Hurricane Jose. The coastal wave show was really something as the swells hit the rocks at Sand Beach and Thunder Hole and the rest of the rocky shoreline. We could have stayed all day watching the water. We drove on to see the 360° views from Cadillac Mt. Looking down onto Bar Harbor gave us a good perspective of the lay of the land, the inlets and the many islands in Frenchman's Bay. A 'don't miss' experience. Very windy and chilly at the top...bring a jacket! Many interesting peaceful hiking trails along the way. One would need two weeks to enjoy all this Park has to offer, but our 4 hour visit was a good start!

We did not have the best weather for our time in the park but we were still able to hike many of the trails and enjoy the beautiful scenery. The hike to Bubble Rock and Jordon pond required some rock climbing but worth the effort. Get to the park early before the crowds arrive and return later in the day.

Absolutely gorgeous scenery. Well run and thought out. Colors could have been further along if only one could control that. All people were friendly and respectful of the grounds and others experiences. We even saw two weddings.
Spectacular hiking, awesome carriage trails for biking, and helpful, friendly park staff/rangers to help find your way or plan a trip. What a national treasure!

Grab a park map at the visitor center. Drive up to Cadillac Mountain for a beautiful view of the park, the ocean, islands, and ships in the harbor. Plus see the reddish Cadillac Granite which is encrusted with green and orange lichen. Along the park road loop, stop at overlooks and beaches to see where the ocean meet the granite. Pack a picnic lunch and your chair, sit on the rocks and take in the majestic views. Parking lots fill up but there is ofter another parking lot a little farther down the road.
review_title: Plan a full day to explore this beautiful park

review_body: We spent about three days here. The beauty is hard to describe, as I don't think any pictures can really do it justice. We camped at Blackwoods campground - my first camping experience and I think I might be spoiled now. Bathrooms were clean and accessible, each campsite was perfectly set up with a fire pit and picnic table.They have shuttles to take you to prime biking spots on the carriage trails, Sunrise at Cadillac Mountain was unforgettable, Jordan Pond and Eagle lake were gorgeous, Sand BEach is a sight to behold - we didn't even get to see most of the attractions. We will definitely be back!
review_title: Outstanding National Park with awesome amenities.

review_body: There is so much to see and do here in such beautiful scenery. We stopped here at the park for a tour while on a cruise and it made me want to go back and camp again. What a great treasure!

I visited many National Parks but Acadia is my favorite so far, we hiked the Ocean Path Trail from Sand Beach all the way up to the Otter Cliffs,sitting up there on the big Boulders taking in the amazing views of the Ocean just breathtaking, not to miss is Thunder Hole which was right of the Trail,their is lots of walk offs of the Trail where you can take Pics or just rest on the Rocks with amazing views of the water, loved the cute little chipmunks everywhere they sure love to entertain :)

What is not to love about Acadia National Park. There are trails of all types including easy boardwalks through swampy land, sand beach walks, trails with breathtaking views along ocean cliffs, rugged trails up ladders and challenging terrain, and mountain trails. If you are not into hiking you can drive through the park or take the free trolley and stop at any area that looks good to you. There are sights, sounds, smells, and touch of nature of all kinds.

The views from Jordan Pond House or atop the North Bubble are excellent! If you have a car, be sure to drive out to the Ship Harbor Nature Trail or hike to the top of Acadia Mtn for some stunning scenery. Photos alone do not capture the beauty of this place. You need to stand atop a mtn, feel the breeze and smell the trees to truly experience Acadia.

Acadia National Park is a rugged New England attraction. Every employee was friendly and helpful - even after dealing with the millions of visitors all summer. Great biking along the carriage roads and hiking for all levels. The view from the top of the mountain was amazing.

Acadia is meant for those who love the outdoors - hiking, biking, kayaking, or rock climbing. We were there for 10 days & still didn't do all the hikes we wanted to. The area is clean and well kept and the rangers are friendly. Loved Acadia and would go back in an instant.

Friends and I spent a week in Acadia Park. We toured the park the first day and then selected places to return to the rest of our trip. We loved the ranger programs--star gazing and Rockefeller's bridges. We took at least 10 hikes, and we ate at Jordan's restaurant. We saw a sunrise and several sunsets. We wandered the sand beach and several pebble beaches. Can't wait to return.
review_title: Spent a Week and Can't Wait to Return

review_body: We spent the day exploring the shoreline in September fog this morning and Sun in the afternoon. Lots of folks out on a Sunday so we looked for hidden gems on back roads. Even in the fog the views can't be beat. With this in mind our two day stay is extended to 10 in a very nice campground just north of Southwest Harbor. If the rain comes we will explore Bar Harbor mid week.

Acadia offers biking on the beautifully maintained carriage trails; hiking for all, regardless of whether one is looking for moderate, difficult or challenging treks; swimming at Sand Beach or just driving along the one way road, observing the stunning scenery.
A must see. Top of Cadillac mountain has nice walking paths and a great view of Bay Harbor and the local islands.
A must see if you are near it. Wonderful tour on a bus and then drive back to spend more time at your leisure.
Lots to do no matter what your physical condition -- carriage ride, hiking, walking, lounging, swimming, driving, biking, gardens.
September is a great time to visit Acadia NP. The weather is good, but much of the crowd is gone, so parking is easy. The down side is the fog.
We went with our daughter (10 year old), and we drove the red loop. It was a blast! Cadillac Mountain was worth the visit all the way from northern Virginia

While we only had a day and a half to explore this beautiful park, we found it accessible and beautiful at every turn. We came here with a group of friends seeking out some of the best spots to take pictures. We found that Cadillac Mountain, while challenging with light, provided some incredible views at sunset. We also enjoyed Sand Beach and the hiking trail (which is fairly challenging) up to the Great Head from there. You get some great perspective and views of the beach below from here. If you don't have a lot of time, stick with the main loop and make use of the pull offs for some great views. We all hope to come back and spend more time in this beautiful park, the pictures we got this time were just great.

We love this park for cycling and motorcycling with friends. Gorgeous views, nice roads, slow traffic. Pull off spots to stop. Parking areas. Lovely walks. Sunset views. Cadillac Mountain, Jordon Pond.
Very beautiful,park with Cadillac mountain being a great place to see the view from on top,of the mountain. The view of the lake and ocean is incredible. Worth checking out.
If you're planning a trip to Maine, Acadia National Park is a must for your "places to see" list. The breathtaking views are endless.
We enjoyed the park, very beautiful views! We took the carriage ride, we learned how the park was first founded.

My expectations were high. The park & its environs exceeded my expectations. You just have to see this to experience it. I would suggest the trolley tour prior to doing it yourself to get the lay of the land. We had 2 days & it was not enough. Keep in mind that the buses from Bar Harbor regularly run through the park so you don't have to drive. The bus system is second best to Zurich.

I first came here when I was 12. Now I am 56 and I brought my wife and kids. It was just as incredible as I remembered it. Each place you stop on the loop road is better than the next. Sand beach was full of people on the beach but only a handful brave enough to go in the water. 50 degree water will do that. The Otter cliffs was one of my favorite stops full of photo opportunities. Mt.Cadillac was breathtaking. My kids couldn't stop taking pictures. Thunder hole was not cooperating but still cool to see. This is a place everyone should see.
We spent the day here, having arrived in Bar Harbor the night before. I believe by arriving early, we avoided some of the crowds. Great loop road, ending up with the highlight of Cadillac Mountain.
review_title: Definitely should be on your bucket list!

review_body: We were there in later August and the crowds, while still there, had thinned out. We had no problem driving the loop road and stopping where we wanted. The hikes were great and the scenery was amazing.

Hiked various trails in Acadia and none disappointed at all! Spectacular views from Cadillac, Gorham, Ocean Path. Kids loved digging at Sand Beach and cooling off in waves after hot summer hike. Enjoyed navigating the planks around Jordan Pond and were rewarded with a field of wild blueberries at the end, along with yummy brunch at the House, esp the beignets as recommend. Could have spent a whole week exploring there. Will take a rock climbing tour next time.

We visited Acadia National Park in late June. We spent 3 days exploring the wonders within. There is a "guided" drivable loop. I recommend picking up the guide pamphlet from the Visitor's Center. The loop is mostly one way which helps avoid some congestion. We were there just before peak and it was not terribly busy. We hiked the other 2 days. Cadillac Mountain, Champlain Mountain, and the Beehive are all great hikes with amazing views. Thunder hole and Sand Beach also a great hike.If you've a Fourth Grader, make sure you sign them up for Every Kid in the Park and they will get free admission for them and your family for the year at any National Park.
Acadia was on our bucket list of places to visit in this country and the world. When you have the opportunity to visit, you will be overwhelmed with the beauty of the area.
What a beautiful place. Sunrise at Cadallic Mountain, thunder hole and sand beach were our 3 favorites!!
The park is beyond words but try stunning, gorgeous, incredible! This may not be on your bucket list but it should be!
review_title: This place will touch your soul

review_body: My husband and I were so pleased by our experience at Acadia National Park that we are thinking about returning on vacation. There is so much to see and do. It seems to require a minimum of at least 5 days to fit in some of the island highlights, but it would be easy to spend more time in such a beautiful, welcoming area. The people are very friendly and I was amazed by how many shops there are in Bar Harbor. It is such a beautiful town and area. The traffic is bad, but we stayed at the Days Inn on Route 3 and either took the shuttle service or walked into Bar Harbor, which was close by. The shuttle service is amazingly efficient and runs like clockwork. Acadia National Park is a wonderful destination and I am so glad that we finally got there as we have talked about it for a long time. Great for individuals, couples and families as there is something for everyone.
review_title: Acadia National Park is a gem

review_body: When I stepped out of my car and walked up the granite stairs to the visitor center I couldn't help but smile in awe. What a beautiful place. Roads and trails that climb a pink granite mountain, meander down to a lighthouse, over to a beach with teal surf and yellow sand, crashing waves and enough bike and hiking trails to keep you busy for weeks. There are also villages such as Bar Harbor, Northeast Harbor and Southwest Harbor that have great restaurants, excellent seafood, historic sites, museums, cruises to smaller islands. It is a phenomenal place.

If you get into the area in the morning you'll no doubt find the experience pleasurable; it is a beautiful area and magnificent view around the island. After that lots of people in your way, and worse, cars, especially on Cadillac Mountain. It was so bad on the mountain that the line of cars going up was a good mile long, stopped, waiting for a parking spot. Park Rangers were standing around watching the mess, but did nothing while we were there. Also, right now major road into the town is blocked and/or closed.
I did a bike tour through the park and it was wonderful. The park is scenic and lovely. It's great for a walk, hike, bike ride, etc.
Beautiful well maintained Park. Provides so many options for all age groups. Beach on Sand beach, walking, hiking to cadillac mountain or bike around eagle lake and much more.

The natural beauty of Acadia National park is overwhelming. Every turn there was a new vista and photo opportunity. This is bucket list location. There is so much to do to and see. Hike, climb the mountains, cycle up Cadillac mountain, or bike the carriage trails. There is something here for every one. Our first day here the forecast for rain. A park ranger suggested to take the park loop road and leave Cadillac Mountain for another day. As we got deeper into the park, the sky's cleared up so we first headed up Cadillac mountain. Now I was a little concerned about this as I have a fear of heights, but the ride up was not bad at all. When we reached the top of the mountain there was a small traffic jam getting into the parking lot. This moved slowly as one car left and another entered the parking area. Only about 10-15 minute wait. And the wait was well worth it. The views were incredible. We came down the mountain and picked up on the park loop road. My favorite stop along the route was Otter Creek. We pulled off the side of the road and every where you looked was a postcard picture, beautiful. We proceeded along the way and headed to Jordan Pond. Jordan Pond Parking lot was full, it was midday. This location is also a favorite starting point to bike on the carriage trails. There were many cyclist here on this day. After not finding a parking space we continued to motor through the park. One beautiful scene after another.We returned to Acadia two days later and found the park less crowded more parking. We had intended to go back up Cadillac mountain but the it was overcast with a threat of rain again. So we headed to Thunder Hole instead. We arrived as the tide was coming in and waited a short while for high tide. But alas, no thunder this day. A few burps thats all.We were at the park over Labor Day weekend. It was crowded but manageable. We are already planning to return as we only scratched the surface of this impressive park. There is so much more to explore.I purchased a week long pass for $25.00. Money well spent.
review_title: This is a Bucket List destination !

review_body: My husband and I hiked the Cadillac North Ridge Trail in Acadia National Park. This trail is listed as "moderate". It was a beautiful hike!! It was a little hard for me. I am no longer "fit" so the hike up was a little challenging, but I did it! It was about an hour and a half up and we did about the same down. The top is stunning. Beautiful views!

Drove the Park Loop and went up Cadillac Mountain once the level of downpour had subsided to acceptable levels of rain. Views seemed to come and go as the clouds passed by.A bonus was the lower than usual level of traffic.
review_title: Great, even on a wet day

review_body: I spent a week in Acadia with my Mother hiking, biking, and boating around Acadia. We found plenty of trails at all skill levels to keep us busy while there any many we didn't have time for that would have been fun to check out. The time and ingenuity that went into building the carriage road system with the number of stone walls and bridges supporting the roads is really impressive.

We were thrilled with Acadia. The hiking/climbing was awesome if you are up for it. Precipice and Beehive trails were our favorites. But if you are not in shape you can still stroll along the ocean on an easy path.
Unbelievable!! Everyone even the fur babies, were waiting for sunrise!! It is cold so dress warm!! Try to get there early!! Pick up something warm to drink!!

We were fortunate to be in Bar Harbor for 4 days, and took advantage of the free shuttle bus from the Visitor Center the first day to orient ourselves on the island. The shuttle goes by every 30 minutes, which is just enough time to check out the stop and decide if you want to do a second visit. It was fun to see all the beautiful old "cottages", take a carriage ride on the Rockefeller Carriage Roads, have a chowder and popover lunch at the Asticou Inn (it was amazing, as was the view!) and watch a sunset from the top of Cadillac Island. There is lots to do for every taste and level of interest.

Such a beautiful park! It's quite expansive even beyond just the main ring road. When exploring the main road, don't be afraid to move along to the next stop if the one you're passing looks full, there are so many great photo stops and they are evenly spaced. Make sure you visit Thunder Hole and the top of Cadillac Mountain for great views and sights. When leaving the ring road through the park, take time to explore the rest of Mount Desert Island that has other parts of the park on the western side of the island. Lots of great towns and stop along the way.
review_title: take a tour, a bus or drive yourself

review_body: Located on Mount Desert Island adjacent to the famous resort city of Bar Harbor Maine, Acadia is a gem of the National Park System. Cadillac Mountain, Jordan Pond, and dozens of hiking trails with magnificent views give you plenty of options for several days of outdoor fun.
review_title: The Gem of Mt Desert Island

review_body: Almost any beautiful picture you've ever seen of the rocky New England coast was taken in Acadia National Park.
